text: Banzo is now my favorite place to eat the deep fried cauliflower was excellent also had lamb , French fries , and many more things and they were all great!

Great "Indie" feeling Falafel house! We had the F-Bomb (in Pita form) and the Big Green Salad (classic, w/ 3 falafels) and they were both FANTASTIC, even a little too big on the portion side! The music, seating, ambiance, and most importantly, the FOOD were spot on for a great dining experience and delicious falafels!

Pros:
+Great flavor, freshness, and quality to the food. The falafels are really top notch. Some of the best I've had in 4 continents, and truly, they are what they're made out to be-TASTY!
+Really chill music playlist that helped add to the ambiance and environment
+Nice decorations downstairs, with oriental rugs and paintings.
+Chalk hand-written menu on an ordering wall is always fun.

Cons:

-It can get quite loud inside, in the downstairs area even with minimal customers (due to poor acoustics?).

-Free water dispensers aren't filled with ice and aren't very chilled

-The Tahini sauce is not particularly flavorful, but the chili sauce you can serve yourself definitely helps bring out its flavor if you mix the two!

OVERALL:

You can't go wrong going here...I hesitate to recommend it completely just so it doesn't get too busy and inaccessible (for me), but really, it's pretty great and the negatives are really minor things that may not bug you, so give it a try!

When I was in grad school, I used to frequent Mediterranean Cafe on State.  Their shwarma sandwiches are killer.  Anyway, they are only open for lunch, so working in Sun Prairie prevents me from getting there with any regularity these days.  

My fiance and I had heard about Banzo, so we gave it a whirl on Saturday.  A few things:

1. I had the F-Bomb and it did not disappoint.  Combo of falafel and chicken was well balanced and flavorful.
2.  We had a side order of pita and hummus.  Also very good.  
3.  We took our order to-go.  The service was snappy and we had some ice cold cucumber flavored water while we waited.  

This will definitely be a "go to" spot for us in the future!

Banzo is the best for many reasons, but consider this:  how many times have you eaten eggplant in a restaurant and it was gooey and soft with a chewy skin?  How many times have you never noticed the eggplant in a dish because it melts away, leaving only the tough, over-ripe and under-cooked skin?  Yes, I agree.  Too many times.  Leave those bad memories behind and eat at Banzo!  Their eggplant is always delicious, structurally intact, and flavorful.  

They are great for vegetarians, vegans, GF, and anyone who loves delicious food.

Would rather eat an item from the hotdog roller at Kwik Trip.

Based on the great reviews this place received we ventured off the beaten path to experience this place...I'm sure my negative experience is an anomaly.

Pros
- The Kombucha and Turkish iced coffee were great. 
- Naan for the Hummus was excellent
- Warm treating at the front
- Falafel was really good! Probably some of the best I've had
- would totally get the Banzo again


Cons
- Chicken Sharma, dry and flavorless
- Schnitzel, dry, hard as a rock
- lentil soup, bland
- Hummus, meh
- $72 after tip???
- bus my own table?
- fill my own water?


In the end, I won't come back. I'm sure this was just one of those bad days for them. The place was full of peeps that obviously enjoy the food...unfortunately, my food left me wanting.

If I worked in an office that was close to this food cart I would do anything I could to get in line at 8 in the morning to be the first person to enjoy a piping hot falafel at lunch time. My boss probably wouldn't appreciate that but I would buy a falafel for him as well. 

I guess what I'm saying is that this is a great falafel and I'd like to eat one right now.

Okay, this is complicated, the food is amazing!
Mainly the hummus, falafel, pita, salad.

It is truly a great place, the best food in Madison.

Here's the problem with Banzo, inconsistency.

Yep, overall great, but on occasions, too many now, food which we order does not have the same recipe as usual, it's not a matter of being slightly off, it's a matter of tasting completely different than before, are they testing their recipes at random?
If so they need to stop it.
We go back to get the same awesome food every time it needs to taste the same, because that's how restaurants work, you have a winning recipe, you stick with it and never deviate, ffs.

This has happened 2 times with the chicken that comes in the F-Bomb.
Their usually awesome rice changes too, the balance of the spices are not right, this has happened 4 times.
The salad also sometimes is not right.
Falafel is sometimes overcooked
And finally sometimes we get the home-made potato chips and other times they are non-existent , about 50/50, seems like it's a bonus prize sometimes if you are especially deserving. But I thought it was supposed to be always included, oh well, bummer.

So that's all weird stuff, they have great products (food/recipes), they need to maintain their quality control, perhaps the people making the food (chefs?) aren't up to par?

Not sure, but we will go back and cross our fingers, if it wasn't for the fact that all the other food in Madison is pretty much crap, Banzo might not taste so awesome, not sure anymore, it's hard to judge in such a culinary void.

Come on Banzo we're rooting for you!

Very good, mostly inexpensive Mediterranean food. Compares well with some of my favorite Mediterranean/Middle Eastern restaurants in Chicago (though a few of those still hold an edge). Definitely my favorite falafel and hummus in Madison. I've had several of the entree options in various forms (on a plate, in a pita) and they're all delicious. They have about half a dozen solid craft beers to choose from.

A few things aren't stellar. Side orders are expensive for a pretty small portion. Like, you pay $4 for what seems like about 3/4 cup of rice or couscous. Also, I've eaten there at least 20 times by now, and I almost always have my order taken by the same few people, but they clearly still have no memory of me (or just don't show it). After a while, this kind of makes a guy feel unimportant.

This place is the best in mad city by far. As good as falafel at sultans market. Very fine cut, tasty salads. As a vegan, this place satisfies every time with plenty of side dishes and main entrees available. 
In the desert oasis of the citys north side, this place is a gods send! Love the owners and food carts too.

The food is stellar BUT the customer service is not friendly or accommodating! I had a catering order for my office, with various special requests, and the person I spoke with was quite irritated and terse with me. I don't appreciate when I am bringing a sizable amount of business and I am treated like an inconvenience...I would advise thinking twice before ordering catering from here - unless you enjoy delicious food with service that leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

On the plus side, the sangria was good.  On the negative side, the food was pretty blah.  It wasn't overtly bad, which I guess is a big accomplishment for the area, but, it really didn't have much in the way of flavor - certainly nothing memorable.  In general, the cooking staff could learn how to properly prepare a meal with salt.  I know there's this big health kick about low-sodium diets.  But, just like the cholesterol hypothesis and the low-fat diet lie, it will be eventually overturned.  In the meantime, we have to suffer with food that's just plain bland.  You know what salt does?  It makes food taste good.  Use it - especially in starchy dishes.  

The shawarma was not tender, and seemed more of a rub than a marinade.  The shish kabob was, as noted before, saltless and bland.  The falafel had great texture - very nice golden brown, light, crispy outside - but again, where the hell is the salt?  The rice (again, almost completely saltless) had no flavor other than what one might call "lentil dirt".  The tabouli was nothing more than chopped parsley sprinkled with bulgar - no salt, no lemon, no mint - it was a complete fail.  The salad was fine - the ingredients were at least very fresh.  But, those ingredients were very recognizable as a pre-mixed salad pack.  I have no idea what the salad dressing was, as I couldn't taste it.  Some kind of oil?  Beats me... 

There were just no bold, striking flavors, which should be present in Mediterranean/middle eastern food .  In the end, the food seems like it was from a moderately high-end buffet (is there such a thing?), and, while not bad, was very overpriced for food that was essentially not "cooked", but rather, "assembled".

Aaron, in response to your previous comment, green-coloured falafel are NOT AUTHENTIC falafel. I lived for 25 years in different middle eastern countries and know what authentic falafel should taste (and look) like. Just for your attitude, I updated my 2 star rating for a 1 star which might be just perfect... Oh, and don't get me started on the  hummus...
Holy hummus!  This place was great.  Everything we ordered was fresh and yummy.

Banzo is mouth watering delicious. I've tried both the Banzo (falafel) and the Harvest (falafel with grilled eggplant) as a pita sandwich as in the platter form. The platter comes with a tasty salad, rice, and a generous side of hummus. So good! I also love the hot sauce and the pickle relish that comes in the pita sandwiches. When I saw the Banzo sign outside of their Sherman Avenue location (near where I live) I did a happy dance. I literally started dancing by myself. That's how good it is!

The food at Banzo is amazing and the staff is so friendly. They have overtime, started to recognize me and my order.  The only downside, is when the weather is nice and it's lunch hour it can get a little slow and you can be waiting in line for awhile. Well worth the wait though the food is great!

Good food not too authentic ,still searching for an authentic middle eastern restaurant in Madison .
Slow service even though they were less busy .

Have only dined at the food cart downtown.  I love falafel and used to make my own but now I only eat Banzo and have seriously had to try not to do it every day. Great food and service for a reasonable price.
Their falafel is great, love the outdoor seating at the Sherman Road location, but most of my Banzo interaction is with the food cart on the capitol square.
Excellent falafel! The hummus is homemade and tasty. Best place to get a good falafel pita sandwich.  Love the outdoor seating as well.

Great place for vegetarian (and not)!
The hummus, tabouli & majadra rice, is just the perfect lunch. Healthy and so good.

Amazing sandwich.  Everything was fresh, well seasoned and really tasty.  I had the F-Bomb with beef which I wasn't sure about but it is well done:  Felafel and mini beef burgers in a pita bread with pickles, tahini, tzatziki yogurt sauce and freshly fried potato chips.    Yum.

There are lot's of veggie options too.

As another reviewer mentioned, the bonzo box is an engineering marvel for taking your sandwich on the go.

One suggestion for the banzo people to achieve total culinary nirvana --  toast or warm the pita bread up for the sandwiches.
Yummmm Falafel. It's delicious! Food cart, or their location are both consistently good.

I'm speechless! Mostly because my mouth is full of fantastic falafel! 

The food was exceptional, all of the hype I'd heard brought me in- but with such great reviews I expected there was no way the actual time I spent here could possibly meet the spectacular reviews. 

It was better. Beyond the tantalizing and diverse main dish, the environment was friendly and calm. The employees were on point and it was all very timely.

Thoroughly impressed, definitely in my top 3 of Madison's food thus far! If you aren't here, get going.

Wow! I am a fan of Banzo. I went in thinking it was probably overhyped, overpriced, and mediocre quality. I was really blown away. My "F-Bomb" pita was loaded with falafel and seasoned chicken. It probably weighed a pound, had tons of flavor, and the pita even held its own without falling into seventeen pieces. 

The falafel is clearly the star in my opinion. Super crispy on the outside, tons of flavor inside and not the least bit greasy or overdone. Loved it. The tahini sauce gives just enough moisture and flavor near the end when you get a little flavor fatigue. 

For $8.97, you really get a steal of a sandwich. Can't wait to return!
Their food card is phenomenal. I've never been to the restaurant location, but their falafel pita is a great choice for lunch.
It's a bit of a drive for me, but the staff is friendly and the food's always great. The banzo or f-bomb in a pita are always amazing choices.

Best falafel I have had, although I must admit I have not had that much.

The price is really good, you can pick it up, have it delivered, or drop on in to eat.  Nothing I didn't love about this place and can't wait to have it again.



Oh, I actually didn't care for the rice but that doesn't change my opinion one bit.

Best falafel in Madison; I could eat their F-Bomb pita sandwiches every day (never having to face the difficult chicken vs falafel decision I am plagued with at most other Mediterranean restaurants). I've been to the carts and the restaurant many times and the staff are always friendly and the food is consistently delicious. Highly recommend!

I love this place- great hummus, falafel, and the eggplant in The Harvest is delicious. They have vegan options clearly labeled, which I always appreciate, and they even had vegan baklava this weekend! You can get your choice as either a sandwich, platter, or salad; I've had the sandwich in the past and this time I got the salad...which was good, but I liked the sandwich better (I think they even put thinly sliced fries into the sandwiches, mmmm). I definitely recommend The Harvest for the eggplant! Everything I've tried there is very good though, this place can certainly compete with other middle eastern food in the area.

The actual restaurant is adorable. It is a little out of the way, but a nice space with a beautiful patio. The service is no nonsense. But the good, oooooh the food. It is so good. Last time we went I had the Harvest, which was delicious. I wish the eggplant was a little less oily. However, they Definitely have the best hummus in town. The toppings really make the meal here. My husband had the Schnitzel which (unsurprisingly) is non-traditional but delicious.
I have never eaten at their restaurant, but I love their takeout! They give a discount for corporate orders, so order at work!

Revising my review after an unfortunate experience. My friend ordered The Banzo. He took a few bites of falafel and then the next bite had chicken in it. He is vegan and gets very ill when he eats meat. I understand that mistakes can happen. But their attitude was what sealed the deal for me. No more Banzo. :( 

***************************************
I love this place for an inexpensive, filling meal, especially when eaten outside on their lovely patio.

I've tried the F-Bomb a couple times, but the chicken was way too salty for me. Now I stick with The Banzo and love the flavors. If only they could layer the ingredients better. All of the salad falls out of the top during the first couple bites, then you get lots of lots of falafel, and then at the end you have a glob of hummus with nothing else but a soggy chip. I usually end up buying a side of hummus (which is delicious) so that I can enjoy it while I eat my pita instead of at the end!

When I first started coming here, I was IN LOVE with their fries. They were perfect!! I don't know what happened...different oil, different cooks, I don't know...but now they are so hard and crunchy and salty they verge on inedible. Bring back the old fries!!

I keep returning for The Banzo, though.

I still love this place and eat there often. The only I problem I have is the constant inconsistencies. Sometimes we get chips in our F-Bomb sometimes not, sometimes the salad in nice other times too much mint or too much onion never the same. Sometimes falafel is perfect and yummy other times overcooked and burnt-ish. Consistency people!

Aaron did reach out to me to rectify the situation and it was much appreciated 

I'm going to use the credit given to give them a second shot, I'll let you guys know how it goes
Best food cart in town!! It's not just a quick bite during lunch hours, it's a real meal!

Food was great.  Wifi neede a little help, thus the 4 stars.  Might have been good, but  they didn't know passord, and fumbled with it a bit.  We never got on the whole time we were there. Leaving, they finally go the password.

But the FOOD! Wow: awesome hummus, amazing falafel balls (not an expert on this, bu they were very tasty).

Love this place.  

The falafel is delicious, and definitely the crunchiest I've ever had (in a very good way).  I also like the fact that they put hand-made chips on the sandwich - very Israeli (they like to put fries on their falafel sandwiches), but with a twist.  

Not the best falafel I've had, but definitely the best I've had in Wisconsin, and it holds up well to the greatest stuff I've had across the US and Israel.

This all is a bit bittersweet for me, as I just discovered Banzo yesterday.  This is bittersweet because I've been looking for good falafel as long as I've been in town (3 years), and am moving away in the fall.  Sad face.  But still I'm happy to have found it.

YUM!  I have eaten at both the cart and the restaurant. And had delivery.  The Harvest pita sandwich is my absolute favorite, somewhat to my surprise, because I usually go carnivore, and I generally don't like sandwiches.  The Baba Ganoush and falafel are terrific.  We have been sampling widely on the menu, and have yet to find anything we don't like. 

Anyway, the food and the service are great.  Highly recommend.

Love Banzo! Super delicious, friendly staff, and speedy. I'd recommend the platter. The best thing on the menu if you ask me.

The only problem I had was nothing to do with Banzo...Apparently, when you order from Eat Street or any 3rd party service, they have to call in the order for you when you place it. Eat Street didn't call it in so I waited an hour and 15 minutes before I called Banzo when they told me this. They were SO SWEET and apologetic even though it wasn't their fault. They made the delivery in record time (20 min) and gave me a complimentary cookie. Love this place.

Although I live in Boston, I've eaten Banzo twice, once in person and once delivery. But I'd like to mention an evening when I couldn't eat it.  I was just too darn full from lunch.
Wife: Order it tomorrow for the flight home?
Me: I'm not leaving from anywhere near Banzo though.
Wife: Maybe, order it tonight and reheat it?
Me: You don't take the Mona Lisa, fold it up and toss it in your backpack, and then hang it in a steamed-up bathroom "to get the wrinkles out."
Tasty and not expensive.  I had a delicious Banzo platter, but soon supplemented it with the squash soup and tabouli.  Pleased by everything on my plate and left with my stomach happily distended.

Have been there twice to order and take-out food.  The portions are HUGE!  Not to mention healthy and delicious!  This is the perfect alternative for fast-food.  I have been hoping for a long time that Madison would get a fast and HEALTHY place where I could drop in and pick up something quickly, and this is it!

I have not been to the food cart, only to the Sherman location which is poorly marked (hopefully not for long), but has plenty of parking and the staff was very friendly.

This place is amazing, came here for lunch yesterday based on the yelp reviews and jackpot! Wanted to come back today, but alas they are closed Sundays. Leaving Madison tomorrow, so I'm gonna try convince my boyfriend we need those delicious falafels one more time. Because we do, they are amazing. If you haven't tried them, you should.

Okay, here's what you do.  

1) Find out where the Banzo food cart is hiding.

2) Order the F-Bomb.  When asked about the sauce, respond confidently with "I'll take all three"

3) Enjoy.

This is one of the best food carts around.  Make sure you show up early---as the lines get kinda long and the service isn't very speedy.   Totally worth it!   Just go now.

Went to their location on the east side because I've heard lots of good things and had been wanting to try it out. I really liked the old house that it was in and the infused water they have out. The food was delicious and HUGE- I didn't realize pita bread could be that large. I got the F-bomp pita sandwich, my friend got the eggplant pita sandwich and my other friend got the schnitzel pita sandwich- everyone gave their choices a thumbs up. The falafel was just as good as everyone says- the texture was incredible and you can see the array of deliciousness that it's composed of when you bite into it. I tried the eggplant and it was also delicious so definitely going to have to get that next time. My only quip is it's fairly expensive compared to other mediterranean restaurants I've been to but it's not going to stop me from coming back (especially now that they have a location on Willy St).

This food cart is awesome! I typically am not a big fan of Mediterranean food but the falafels were so perfectly fried and the sauces perfect (my favorite is tahini), that this is one of the most perfect lunch choice at Library Mall. Everything is cooked to perfection, but I would definitely recommend getting the falafel rather than anything else, because seriously, the fried chickpeas is supremely perfect, with just the right amount of spices. Mmmm makes me hungry just thinking about it! I wish I were a student again so I can get this every week. Perfect for a quick lunch between classes/student jobs.

Banzo has the BEST felafel sandwich in Madison.  I like the felafel at the Mediterranean cafe more,  but there sandwich doesn't hold a candle to this place.  The meal is huge and the sauces are delicious.  Just writing this review makes me want another!

You should know that they aren't really fast.  Fast enough, but expect a little wait.  And, the level of red onion in the salad varies A LOT.  Steer clear of that topping if you don't care for it.

Wow!  Was missing all these good eats since I lived in Israel and then New York.  The hummus is wonderful, and the best pita I've had in forever.  I took a friend who had never had any of these foods, and she loved it also.  We both had the F-bomb plate.  She had the beef and I had the chicken.  We both preferred the chicken because we like spicier foods.  Definitely will be back.

The Banzo cart is a winning addition to the plethora of Madison food carts. It provides authentic Israeli food at a good price. Natalie and Aaron who run the cart are so nice! 

And to make Banzo even better, now they deliver!

I had the F-bomb platter with mini burgers and it was delicious. Super fresh and even satisfied me and my boyfriend for lunch. The falafel could have been hotter but you cant blame them because they are fighting the cold And serving during 30 degree temperatures. Im so glad Banzo is here!!!

This place has really gone downhill! We used to order delivery all the time. We had noticed a decline in quality and service but kept giving them the benefit of the doubt. The last two times have been horrible!! The food arrives cold and is not the same high quality it used to be and the order tonight took two hours to arrive. On the plus side, they did refund our money. I would love to see them get back to where they used to be!

I tried the restaurant yesterday. The falafel was to die for -- I'm still dreaming of it! I got the whole wheat pita (a stab at being healthier). It was soft and delicious, not dry at all. The hummus was really good, too. I can't wait to go back!
Fantastic felafel and hummus.  Generous portions and reasonably priced.  We will be back!
The falafel had good flavor, but unnecessarily greasy- made my stomach pretty upset. Also, the sauce seemed to be more mayo than tahini...?
Easily one of my favorite places in Madison, and the best falafel I've ever had. Good, high-quality and healthy ingredients. Fast delivery. Easy takeaway!

Ordered the Chick Platter.  I expected grilled chunks of chicken on a bed of rice, but instead received shredded chicken flavored with taco seasoning.  Guess I should have ordered the F-bomb, but chose not to since I'm not into falafel.  Maybe the chicken with that would have met my expectations.

Saw the new cart while walking by the corner on E. Main and MLK on Capitol Square.  My wife had tried it at UW and liked it and I'd read good things too, so I jumped in line. I ordered the F-Bomb (how could I not?) and scampered back to the office.  OMG.  I came really close to going back and getting another one.  It was that good.

I don't think I have ever seen a more overrated place in my life and I have been to a number of hipster places in Chicago.

First off, the people working at the actual restaurant location are a pretty inane lot forgetting they have you on hold or even not putting you on hold so you can hear their loud and annoying voices do other things.  One time I clearly stated my order with all the details needed (wheat pita etc.) and they still had to go through the litany of standard order questions.  It seriously came to the point where I did not eat here solely because I didn't want to go through the ordering process.

How's  the food?  Well it's obviously decent enough that I ate here multiple times despite the incompetence at the front desk.  They make good ingredients, in particular their hummus is really good.  Unfortunately, they can't make a sandwich worth a damn.  There is no balance to how the ingredients are arrayed in the sandwich with sauce maybe lightly coating the top or bottom if they are not passing it off in a side container.  Sometimes the chicken is cut up into manageable pieces, others you are left to rip the unwieldy pieces up yourself.  With my last visit the pita itself fell apart when I took it out of its box spraying toppings all over my floor.

If you want a good pita sandwich I recommend a place called New Amsterdam in Omaha, which is cheaper, better and gives you more food.  Basically the only thing Omaha has ever added to civilization.  Meanwhile I suggest you skip the Banzo cart and try the Thai cart or the Peruvian cart or the Indonesian cart where they are serving up something tastier and more unique.

First allow me to share my falafel pedigree.  I hail from the Detroit area, which with approximately 200,000 people of Arab descent has the vibrant culture and cuisine that comes along with a large expat population.  Which is to say, when it comes to Mideastern food and Lebanese food in particular Detroit is something of a Mecca.  I grew over time to love this food dearly.  This is to say, I am a bonafide and unreconstructed falafel snob.

I haven't lived in Detroit since 2006 and everywhere I have lived since (Connecticut, Chicago, Madison) I am perpetually disappointed in the flavorless mush balls passed off as falafel.  These atrocities are presented by well meaning friends with great excitement upon discovering my love for the stuff, and I try my best to be polite while choking down the bland goo slathered with crappy hummus.

And thus had been my fate until last Friday when my wife and I happened upon Banzo.  This falafel is the real deal.  Freshly prepared with a hot and crispy exterior shell and a wonderfully textured center, they are seasoned just right.  There are many options for how to get them - in a pita, a hummus plate, etc, but just get them.  If you've had falafel at People's Bakery, Great Dane, or any of the other establishments in town - no disrespect to them - withhold judgement until you have tried Banzo.  This is the only legit falafel in town, probably the only legit falafel in the state.

Finally tried Banzo last time.  How did we live in Madison for almost a year without trying this place?  There is such a buzz about Banzo, and the time was finally right.  And good thing because my mouth and tummy have never been so happy.  My husband got the chicken F bomb platter and I got the Harvest platter and we shared a baklava.  The hummus and pita were delicious.  The salad dressing was amazing!  and eggplant and falafel I could eat daily for an eternity.  The baklava was the best I've ever had.  The only less than amazing was the rice, which was still yummy but you know it was rice so.  Will definitely be back here as much as possible.  We got it to-go so can't say much about the service but the place was pretty packed.  BANZO = YESZO

Falafel is one of my favorite things but Banzo is not. I was happy to hear that a location was open close to home - but I wasn't so happy after my first, second and third experiences. I felt like I was bothering the staff with the questions I had while ordering and I was told during my last trip that my full punch card wouldn't be honored. Loved the food but the customer service was lacking.

With a diverse selection of food cart options in Madison, its hard to choose where to spend your cash. Don't waste any of your precious lunch break time and head straight to Banzo. This noteworthy Mediterranean cart introduced me to the falafel a year ago, and I've been hooked ever since. 

I recommend "The Chick" served as a Pita Sandwich, and if you're at the Library Mall location you can't go wrong by enjoying the deliciousness while basking on Bascom Hill. I've also heard firsthand from a reliable source that "The Harvest" is a quality vegetarian option.

Oh my, oh my, oh my. Madison, you are so lucky to have Banzo! The pita is fresh and soft. The hummus is exactly perfect and creamy. The falafel - muah. You wouldn't expect a simple dish of rice and lentils to be worthy of craving, but, trust me, it really is. Add to that the condiments that heighten all the flavors: pickles, chili garlic sauce, fresh tahini - wow. 

For those looking for a caterer - and a vegan-friendly caterer at that - Banzo is pro. They were on time, everything was delivered fresh and beautiful. The only thing is that you should contact Banzo far in advance. The staff is very busy filling bellies with the best food ever, so getting a solid catering plan ironed out may take some coaxing and more work on your end. But it's so worth it!
Worst Mediterranean food ever. Their Hummus is bitter and expensive for what they offer. The kabobs I ordered appeared to be stale. don't eat here

Banzo has the best Israeli food I've had outside of Israel! The F-Bomb and The Chick are my favorites. Literally the best falafel and eggplant I've had, and to add to the deliciousness, they have an assortment of really great toppings and extras! Fun workers too, its a pleasure to stand outside their cart in the cold weather!

Banzo and Shuk has the best Mediterranean food in Madison. My Palestinian cousin from Israel was visiting Madison. We were at a catered event. He told me Banzo's food is the most authentic Israeli food he has ever eaten in the US. Their food is fresh, flavorful and filling. I love the owners. They are wonderful and generous people. Madison is lucky to have such a great Mediterranean food option.

I tried utilizing Banzo's delivery service, and forty five minutes later, it still hadn't arrived. I called and the employee claimed that it was just running a little late. Twenty minutes later, still no Banzo. I called again and the employee claimed the delivery driver had dropped it off, but there was no food to be seen. I cancelled my order and spoke to the manager. I love Banzo's food, but I'll never order delivery from them again.

My apologies for boring you with another 5 star rating here but Banzo is the bee's knees. Saturday was our first visit here and the felafel platter I had was perfect. I could eat it every day. Props to the chef for the side of chili sauce - what a great complement that I never would have thought of.

This place makes me wish I lived in Madison. I've eaten there twice in the past few months when I've been in Madison and now I dream about it! The falafel is perfect, chicken shawarma is tender and flavorful, and hummus is delicious. Also, the people who work there are very friendly. If they ever opened a location in Milwaukee, id go weekly!
$3 à la carte for the best falafel in town? Absolutely. Perfectly fresh and crispy. Very happy to find Banzo.
Yum! The best Mediterranean food we have ever had. Ask for the house green hot sauce. You won't be sorry. If we were to do it again, we would stick with the falafel, it's done to perfection.

Going gonzo over Banzo. First ate in house and had perfectly made crisp falafel sandwich. Second, took out falafel and grilled eggplant sandwich. Got home and it was still hot!  The sauces are also delicious. Not to mention the handy dandy to go boxes that carry your booty upright and covered. I have been daydreaming about going back often!!  Thank you for truly well prepared fresh food. A quantum leap above your usual middle eastern inspired restaurant.
Yum!  The falafel is my favorite.  The pickled salad they serve is amazing.

I ate falafel at their food cart at farmers market. 
It was one of the best falafel I ever had. 
Definitely best place to eat falafel in Madison. 
Now they have a restaurant which is great. Dont forget to add their yogurt sauces.
The food is phenomenal. Instead of Ben & Jerry's ice cream, I'd rather eat a whole quart of Banzo's hummus with a spoon.

Banzo has excellent food at reasonable prices.  I ordered the F-bomb chicken pita for $8.50 and the falafel side for $3.95.  I was full after only eating the falafel.  Both were great.  I ordered off of yelp for the first time and it worked without a problem.  The delivery was quick and the delivery driver was very friendly.  Good job Banzo!
Absolutely delicious every time.  I have no idea how they make such relatively common food items (hummus, rice, falafel, etc.) taste so extraordinary.

The falafel was too salty (I thought so the last time I had their food, but hoped it was a fluke, but that seems to be how they make it), and it was also undercooked (pretty mushy) inside. Rice was OK. The hummous was also too salty.  Two tiny pieces of pita with a lunch plate were a disappointment (it is very good pita but not enough to eat the fillings with.) Fried eggplant were DRIPPING with oil. Salad was mostly cabbage. Cashew baklava was mostly filo dough; I could not discern any nuts.  Somehow their quality seems to be slipping. I had indigestion afterwards from all the oil, and my son the falafel fiend was disappointed too.

This five star rating is aimed at the delivery service, which seems to be overlooked and underrated. I've eaten both at the cart and the Sherman Ave. location and they would both rate a solid 4 stars, but delivery really is as good as it gets.

I've gotten Banzo delivered about a dozen times (ranging from 5 pm to 10 pm) and every time it's here in under half an hour. Not only is it quick but the food is always hot, the drinks cold, and the deliveryperson friendly. As a former delivery driver and someone who orders delivery often, I honestly don't know how it could get better.

I have eaten here many times and have also visited their cart on library mall. The sandwiches and platters are both good, I especially like the Harvest and F-bomb options. 
The humus platter/side has a generous amount of humus but they don't give you enough pita.
The fries are....pretty terrible. I was super hungry and needed more than just the pita sandwich so I ordered their hand cut fries. They should add in their explanation that they douse it with seasoning. There is way too much oregano or something and I couldn't even eat more than a few fries, over seasoned, dry and cold.

Other than the fries, their food is good for a filling lunch, If you like sauce be sure to order more because they only give you a small container.

Behold the fulfillment of my falafel dreams!  I first had a falafel pita Amsterdam Falafelshop in DC and fell in love.  Since then I have eaten falafel in several cities and states, but nothing ever quite lived up to that first one... until I had the Banzo!  Some falafel I've had were just fried flavorless balls, but here they are crazy crazy yummy.  Plus all the yummy pickles and whatnot that goes into the pita and the two sauces they serve with it (way better than any tahini I've ever had), and you've got a lunch worthy of the cravings that will inevitable ensue.   All hail the chickpea!
Great falafel and pita and yogurt sauce. Also super flavorful smooth hummus. I will be back!

A great dining option near the Dane County Regional Airport. It's housed in a refurbished house with a nice little patio area for al freso dining.

We ordered the F-Bomp Pita Sandwich and the Chick Platter. The F-Bomb was served in a warm wheat pita pouch that contained two lump balls of falafel, chicken (choice of beef also available), pickles, chips, and diced bites of julienne cabbage, cucumber, tomatoes, red onions, and cilantro. The falafel was really rich in flavor and the chicken was well marinated with abundance of flavor. You can choose tahini, yogurt or Siraccha chili sauce as a side, but we wanted to try all three and the staff happily obliged. The Platter is like the containment of the pita sandwich spilled onto a generous sized divided plate, it had the marinated chicken chunks, cucumber salad, slices of pita, with hummus and rice. 

It was $3 more than the sandwich and worth the price, it was big enough for two. 

The falafel had a really nice mixture of spices and good consistency. It was odd because one of the two was dry, but dredging it with tahini quickly solved that problem. 

I wish they serve a side of just their chips, they were so crunchy, dark in color, and rich in flavor of whatever oil it was fried in. Mmmm... heavenly!
Amazing! Highly recommend and I am a tough critic. The hummus is top notch, best I've ever had. Same with the falafel. Oh how I wish I worked downtown Madison so I could go to the food truck weekly!

YO THIS SH*T WAS PHENOMENAL. This is hands down the best falafel place ive tried and ive tried a lot of falafel. it's vegan and gluten free too I believe so I didnt have to worry about the devil that is dairy mess up my insides because of my lack of lactase or whatever. EAT HERE. Eat the falafel. Im going to go broke, the food cart is a block from my house. Say a quick prayer for my bank account. Mad good.

If I lived in Madison, I would be eating at Banzo all the damn time. As it is, we found out about Banzo via an article in a Madison magazine, so it was merely by chance that we decided to seek it out when we returned home from Mt. Horeb. 

Banzo's concept is simple: you basically pick groups of ingredients (e.g., I ordered the Harvest, which contains falafel, roasted eggplant, and a few other things) and how  you want it prepared (pita sandwich, salad, hummus plate, or platter). My husband ordered the F-Bomb (delicious chicken) platter, and I ordered the platter as well with the Harvest. I also tried a side of their tabouli, the salmon/avocado soup, and we both got ice teas. 

Their iced tea is amazing, first of all. I have never had better iced tea. And the food was delicious: we really liked the rich tahini flavor of the hummus and the crisp but fresh texture of the falafel. In addition to the hummus, we both got salad and rice with the platter, and both were outstanding. The flavor of the rice was out of this world!

Their flavors were really unique -- the chicken my husband ordered had a taste that we really couldn't pin down, but it was a good taste. The same goes for the rice, which seemed to have turmeric or curry in it. My only complaint was that they did not use basmati rice but regular, short-grain rice, which seems odd for a restaurant serving Middle Eastern cuisine. 

We really enjoyed our meal at Banzo and can't wait to visit Madison so that we can eat there again!
Order at the counter and the food will be brought to your table. Staff was knowledgable about the food an ingredients used. Get the falafel plate!

Hands down the best falafel and hummus in Madison. Actually, some of the best I've ever had in my LIFE (I'm talking in comparison to platers of hummus in Turkey and North Africa).
I order delivery from this place ALL THE TIME.

Holy crap, this was awful. We were in the mood for some Mediterranean food and decided to get some Banzo to go. This was the first time checking out this joint. We order a couple of lamb platters at about $15 a piece and head home, looking forward to a good meal. 

Came home, excited to check out the star of the dish and bite into some medium rare lamb, only to find four small, unappetizing, slider looking pucks of meat. On first taste it was confirmed to be overcooked, over-salted, super-spicy, dried up mix of lamb, spices and god knows what else.       

The rest of the container consisted of a very small salad, a smidgen of rice, 1 large potato chip broken in half, some hummus and half of pita. The sides were ok but I was shocked how little food it was for almost 15 bucks. 

So disappointed! Way overpriced and, more importantly, the food was complete garbage.

The falafel at Banzo is the best I ever had. Every time I pick up food or they deliver, you sense the genuine pride in the employees. I recommend the Banzo platter to give you a taste of some of the Banzo favorites. Whatever these folks are doing, they are doing it right. I love the "hidden gem" location, but if they consider venturing downtown, I know they will do very well!

Banzo knows their beans.

I've been searching for great falafel ever since Caspian Cafe shuttered years ago and I've found it!  

I've had their food delivered to work and my apartment a bunch of times and I finally made it to the cart(check out their fbook or twitter accounts for specials and location).  The line and wait for food can be long, but please, I BEG you, to stick it out.  I've had a chance to explore most of their menu and it's all wonderful.

The food is so reasonably priced, especially give the portion size. You can have a pita sandwich with your choice of filling that comes in a well-designed to go box, or upgrade to a hummus plate (some of the best in town), or a platter.  Nothing will set you back more than $10.

I saw that they're going to be open for late night food soon and I can't wait!

Review for the food cart.

Excellent falafel for a very reasonable price. It's a little messy, but worth it. Do you need anything else from a restaurant? 

The people were polite and pleasant to deal with.

If you haven't been to Banzo on Sherman, you definitely should check it out.  I usually get the Banzo or Harvest platter.  I prefer the platter over the pita sandwich because it's easier to maneuver.  The soups are also delicious.  The only thing I've found that I don't care for is the couscous tabouli, which is almost entirely made of coarsely-cut parsley.  The service is great, and the owners are extremely friendly!

Be careful ordering Bonzo "to go". They are expensive and most times your order is wrong or missing apps. We order it a lot, because we love their food, but come on Bonzo. This is getting a little repetitive. Could be my last time and that's too bad because there is no good food to order on the Northside

Great food, fast delivery. Ordered the shawarma pita and F-bomb - highly recommended! Was told 45 minutes to an hour, but the delivery was here 30 minutes later. Everything was fresh and yummy. Very good value for my money.
I would put this place in my Top 5 falafel I have ever had in my lifetime. And I have lived a lot of places.

I came to try the banzo falafel pita. The pita bread was hot and fresh but the overall experience of flavor was lacking. I thought the falafel ball interior was too dry. The exterior of the fried bean ball was semi-burnt. The tahini side sauce was also very bitter. The hummus and chopped pickle topping combo was pretty good but there wasn't much of it to be found. 

This place is a far cry from Amsterdam falafel shop in DC.

Thank goodness for this little bright green food cart near capital square. While I have yet to visit the brick and mortar, I have been to their cart more than a handful of times and have never been disappointed - definitely my go-to when my coworkers and I decide to walk the square for lunch. The food is all made with fresh ingredients, which is noticeable in everything from their pitas to their hummus to their proteins.

I regularly order the chick pita, which is chicken tenders in their house marinade, a slaw salad and hummus all inside a pita. You can order a full or half pita and it comes in a little box that makes it easy to eat the pita on the go or back at the office. The big green salad is also yummy. You can add chicken or falafel or both (aka the F-Bomb). The lemon-agave dressing drizzled on top is a must!

Personally, I've only had the Banzo Sandwich (falafel pita).  Once I have something I love, I prefer not to mess with perfection.  I've traveled in Israel, and this falafel is the real deal (which makes, since according to the website one of the owners is Israeli).  The pita bread is fresh and soft, the three sauces are authentic, and the Banzo box makes eating a delight (if you tear the strip around the side, you can eat out of the box and not make a mess all over yourself).

After only ordering delivery for two years, I finally ate at the restaurant. It is super cute, with decent service and a glorious patio.  I agree with others that it would be nice to have the option to put my fries in my pita, but this doesn't seem to be an Israeli thing so we might just have to do the heavy lifting on our own.  My feeling diners have always been pleased with their platters, but they tend to make wistful comments about my cute little sandwich (which is enough for two meals).  I suggest starting with a sandwich and working your way up from there.  If you aren't sure if your love for falafel, order a pita at lunch, when you get two for $10. You can give me the other one.

So I ate at their restaurant and not the food truck. Had the Schnitzel and it's damn good. It's a chicken schnitzel and the crust on the chicken is crunchy but more importantly, the chicken throughout is really, really juicy and tender. I was super pleased. The rice and salad that came with it were solid also. Would definitely repeat this place, and if the rest of the dishes are as solid, would make this place a regular.

They were totally right to rate this place best new food truck in Madison.  Everything is fresh, cheap, and delicious.  And the people who run the truck are super cool, and will happily tell you about where ingredience, recipes etc come from.  Great new place.
This is a great place to support. The owners are wonderful people they hire awesome people. The view from the new outdoor seating area is amazing. The food taste like it was made with love.

Holy delicious Mediterranean food-super fresh and delicious.

Everyone at our table of eight was impressed with lunch, and I'd go back in a heartbeat. I got the F-Bomb in a pita, and was a solid choice, but I think I'll do a platter next time.

Banzo is my favorite Madison restaurant. 

Straight forward Mediterranean food. 

Chicken Shwarmah special and falafel balls are my two favorite items. 

Their ice tea is great, and you get one free refill when you dine in at the restaurant.

Visiting family in Madison, and was hungry during lunch time, decided to try this place out since it's got great reviews on Yelp, ordered the chick plater to go, the service was good and time we received our food was under 10mins. The chick plater was so deliciously fresh and good, I ate it all and wanting more!! We will definitely be back again when we visit Madison.

Hey. We were greeted by a couple as we perused the menu by the register. They surmised we were newbies and said we were in for the best middle eastern anywhere. Granted that's in the gut it the beholder. We must have the same guts. If you're in the area, and like muddle eastern cuisine, don't miss this place. It may be informal in appearance, but fear not. It's clean and the food is the best. The eggplant was off the chart but everything we had was terrific. Big platters in the low teens. Totally satisfying. Enjoy!
Was worried about finding falafel in Madison, but this place is amazing!!!! Awesome hummus and salads, too. It's the only thing you can order for delivery that won't kill you.

This review is for the food cart.

AMAZING. For the price I got my food at, 5 stars worthy for sure.

The people there were super nice, but also conversational which didn't make the interaction awkward. Despite the swarm of other customers nearby, they calmly took their time with me, having never been there before, to explain the different menu items, how long some would take, etc. I eventually decided on the F-bomb pita with beef kebab.

They said they were grilling the kebabs fresh but it still took less than 5 minutes; plus the other people surrounding the cart. The beef is ground, which I didn't expect, but every bite was just as flavorful as the next. After looking at yelp reviews online, apparently all the craze is the chicken. Could the chicken be THAT much better than the beef? I can't wait to try that out too. The flavor combination of the pickles, hummus, salad, chips with the sauces is INCREDIBLE. I don't know how it works out so swimmingly, but it resulted in a near-mouthgasm (amazing for 7 bucks).

I know everyone raves about the falafel, and it's no joke: I was legitimately saddened the moment I ate the last bite of falafel. My heart actually sank when I didn't see any more of that luscious, yellow-green falafel interior enclosed by the perfectly crispy brown crust. Holy f***. It's so good. Granted, I'm not a falafel enthusiast (I've had it like... 2-3 times maybe?) but I think I am now!

I only have 2 minor complaints which were definitely trivial enough to keep my 5-star rating:

First is the portions; 1 sandwich was definitely not enough, but 2 would've been overkill. Maybe I'll have to get the platter next time!

Second is the sandwich construction: As ingenious as the paper box is, the sandwich proportioning at the end is a let down. Let's put it this way: the meal ends on a much lower note than when it starts. Obviously it's because they have to stuff the pita from the opening, so there's all the yummy sauces and good stuff at the beginning and at the end it's the leftover liquid soaking up the last pita bites, but it does take away from the experience.

But seriously. So good. I will come again to buy The Chick platter and a special side of falafel, because 2 of those fried babies simply is not enough for me. YUM.

I've never had a bad meal here! Their falafel is amazing. The only gripe I have is that they are stingy with the yogurt sauce. I like to use a good amount with my pita and the sides of sauce that they give you are tiny, ask for extra!
Over done felafels less filled cartons then usual. My favorite delivery food. All other delivery's great

I love this place.  One of the go-to carts on the Library Mall (be sure to follow on fb or twitter for location updates).  Their popularity during lunch may keep you waiting for 10 min.

Their eggplant sandwich is amazing.  The f-bomb sandwich with chicken (includes their falafel) with hot and yoghurt sauce is amazing.  All their sandwiches come in cardboard containers that open up like a zippo lighter to easily nom down the sandwich without spilling any of the good stuff.

I met Aaron and Netalee when they were down by Dayton and Orchard (by Union South, DoIT, CS) and they were extremely kind -- I only wish I could randomly run into them again; they don't seem to work in the cart when I go for lunch! :(
Best middle eastern food in Madison. I love how smooth their hummus is. Always the right amount of tahini.

Do you love falafel? Well I certainly do. The falafel here was as good as any falafel we had overseas. It reminds me of the falafel we ate in London last year.  We ate outside and had a great time for lunch. Very worth the trip on your scooter or bike.   Prices are very good and service isterrific.

I came here one night expecting mediocre but acceptable falafel. I was a in hurry and needed sustenance.  MIND BLOWN!  I got the falafel atop a chopped greek salad.  Phenomenally delicious with the local craft beer I had at the location. Honestly, the falafel was perfectly prepared.  Texture precise: crispiness of exterior and the softness of the interior  - WOW -  magical in my mouth!  I have since made "chopped" greek salad and it's a dream.  I will definitely be back again!

Still wonderful... clean, quick and dependable. The owner is lovely and he treats his staff with respect. I always eat the chicken but occasionally try something new. I am never disappointed but always end up with the chicken.
Tiny space but they manage. I am always pleased with the bathrooms. Hey, that's super important.

Check it out. Easy on the wallet, delicious on the tongue.
The F-bomb platter is seriously the BOMB! We get takeout from here and it is always quick and fresh. I also love their falafel and hummus. Reasonably priced, extremely fresh, and always a go to!
I had the F bomb pita sandwich and it was the best thing I've had in a long time. I can see why it's called the "f bomb" it was f-in amazing!

Casual Middle Eastern eatery with counter service and a small number of indoor table (some outdoors when the weather permits). I usually take away. The service can be curt, but the food is amazing so I generally look past it. The hummus and falafel are what you go for. The pita is imported from Israel - it's the real thing.

I ate here last night with my fiancé and I have already raved about my meal to at least 3 people! I had heard about the awesome food truck and recently heard there was also a restaurant but assumed it might just be open for lunch, I was wrong it's off the beaten path but close to everything and easy to get to. They are open until 9pm on most nights! They also deliver! I have no good excuse for waiting so long to make it here! Delicious!! I cannot wait to go back, last night we had the chicken pita sandwich and chicken rice platter but look forward to trying the falafel. They have delicious homemade soups too! They have a cozy patio with a view of Burrows park which will keep me dreaming of summer.
Love banzo! Come here all the time and visit their cart also. Great food all around. Always fresh tasting, great summer spot to sit outside.

Usually not a big Mediterranean food lover.  Everyone makes it differently, some good some not so good.  Banzo however is a welcome surprise.  Tried the "F-bomb" plate.  We did both the chicken and the beef.  Comes w/2 falafel balls, rice, bread, hummus and a little dressing.   Seriously, the best!!  Very reasonable price, quickly served.  I preferred the beef just a bit more.  Well prepared-hummus was very very good.  Not garlicky or overpowering.  Selection of wine as well as some non-Mediterranean dishes are availble.  Atmosphere: its the Isthmus.  Free Wi-Fi, you have to get the password while I normally don't like that, I can understand not paying for the neighborhood to have free Wi-Fi and reserving it for your customers.  Inside and outside seating.

Great experience, value for money, will return again and again.

Wow wow wow. The food tasted so delicious, so clean, the best falafel I've ever had. 

I highly suggest getting the F-Bomb platter, lots of delicious treats on one plate. 

Highly recommend!

Choose wisely for 5 star food! 

I had been to the food cart a handful of times for a quick lunch so after a paddle on the lake we decided to stop in for a late dinner. 

The restaurant is causal, patrons order at the counter and food is brought to the table. 

I had every intention to try something not offered on the food cart menu, but I failed. I got the dependable f-bomb platter with chicken. As always, it was delicious! The falafels were perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. My friend had never been there before, that was my recommendation to her also. She told me she did not like falafels, so of course I took that as a challenge. She got the kebab, and enjoyed it. Most importantly, she now loves falafels. Friends have tried other menu items and not enjoyed them. My advice to you... get the f-bomb for a great variety of some of their best menu items. We each got the sangria - which was ok and shared the baklava (orange and walnut) - which was amazing! 

We sat on the outdoor patio which was quiet and intimate. It had beautiful lights strung overhead and made for the perfect spot for us to catch up without the pressure of a server.

This is the best hummus and falafel.  Whether you get the platter or the sandwich, it is awesome.  The falafel is perfectly cooked every time.  The seasoning and flavors is amazing.  The veggies are fresh and blend the flavors very well.  I think I've only gotten the ones with chicken.  It is too good to pass up.  The pita and hummus are the best I have ever had.
Tasty and in good price. This is my first time to try banzo and not bad. But should have eaten with water or coke, otherwise it's too dry and oily.

I'm a huge fan of food trucks and love me some good falafel. Banzo married these two better than any I've sampled! I would stand in line through blazzing heat and brutally cold days just to eat lunch here. 

Thank you Banzo.

Really great hummus and falafel! Love ordering delivery from here. I am a fan of ordering the hummus plate options, because it comes with a ton of hummus and you can eat it for days. They also have yummy pickles you can get on the side. 

Tip: if you are calling for delivery, ask what the ETA will be. Sometimes it can take a pretty long time. Though usually worth the wait!

Meh. The meat was tasty and well-seasoned. The falafel was interesting, but the serving sizes didn't seem "fair" or "satisfying" as a choice for a meal. :\ I don't think that the ingredients are *too* expensive and compared to foods like sushi, the prep for falafel and pita is probably "medium-low" (I don't know, just guessing, so my opinion ought to be taken with a grain of salt) but I think Banzo could do well to be a bit more generous with their food

This place certainly does not disappoint. It is one of my favorite places to go for lunch. My favories include their Falafel, hummus, pita, and madras rice.  I'm not sure how they make their hummus, but it is so ridiculously creamy and addicting.

Truly great falafel has been sorely missing from Madison for a very long time. Places like Shish Cafe and Med Cafe offer up a pretty decent shawerma but the falafel around town has always been dry and oddly-flavored up until now. Banzo makes a falafel that rivals the stuff I have eaten in the Middle East, at prices that rival some parts the Middle East - particularly Israel, where one of the founders originates.

The authenticity does not stop at the falafel, either. Schnitzel is a staple of Israeli cuisine due to the Ashkenazi influence, while their "mini-burgers" are blended with a truly Middle Eastern mix of spices, vegetables, and fat. I have no idea why they call them mini-burgers though, because they are undoubtedly the very same kofta meatballs I grew up eating in an Egyptian household.

I just wish they would open on the weekend, because I've already suffered many a disappointing hangover wherein a juicy falafel sandwich would have been exactly what I needed.

Banzo could also seriously benefit from taking a couple pages from Israel's own falafel enterprise: 
1. Add laffeh bread to your menu. Your pitas are excellent but I would more than willingly pay a slight upcharge for the "Chipotle burrito" of falafel sandwiches.
2. Give me the option to stuff chips (french fries) in my falafel.

My suggestions should in no way be taken as "needs improvement," though. There's no doubt in my mind that the Levantine Arab style of falafel is the best in the world, and Banzo absolutely nailed it. The fact that they deliver makes this THE go-to place for delicious and even healthy fast food.

A twist on the authentic that thoroughly succeeds. I've always enjoyed what I've gotten here. The only hindrance is that it is a bit expensive. That being said, I'll continue to return for the falafel and well seasoned hummus.
I am picky about my food. I have tried other falafel in the city and banzo is by far the best place to go for it.  Simple and delicious!

Absolutely wonderful!  Seriously, their falafel is the best I've ever had, and I'm pretty familiar with the stuff.  It's a popular cart, so you might have to do some waiting, especially if you come during the noon hour.  Both the plate and the pita are amazing, but I find the flavors of the pita with the pickled vegetables, chips, hot sauces all smothered together just fantastic.  Go for it - you won't be sorry.
Friendly service, great falafel. I hear they have started up local delivery which is great when you need a healthy late night fix.

BEST falafel AND hummus in town... and the eggplant steaks are magical. These falafel have the perfect crunch, but I wish there were better kid options - mine don't care for the spicy chicken and you can't order it plain. But hey... I gotta give the best five stars!

Found these guys on yelp. Called for delivery. They told me I was out side there delivery area, so I offered an additional $10. They took me up on the deal! Got the f bomb platter it was great, hand cut frys are the best I have had in Wisconsin (by far)! Falafel was great, I mean really great, hummus was fresh and tasty!  Lentil soup was very good. I have two complaints. They sent Hunts ketchup,  sorry it sucks, and the salad was just OK. The green mix was good but the dressing was oily and flavorless. Still worthy of a 5 star rating.

I tried the lentil soup and the eggplant platter and had it delivered to my hotel while I was in town. Delicious food! The portion was bigger than I had expected, the falafel was crispy and yummy and everything tasted amazingly fresh! Will order again when I'm around!

This is my new favorite restaurant for Mediterranean. I've been to the restaurant for both dinner and lunch, and both times were great. I went with a bunch of girlfriends for dinner a few weeks ago. I had the F-bomb platter for dinner and it was a LOT of food for not much $$. We were in and out in an hour, and there was NO conversation during dinner -- I think b/c everyone was so busy eating their yummy dinner. 

I had the Chicken hummus plate for lunch yesterday. Next time I'll go pita or platter -- anything that comes with falafel! I'm excited this place delivers to my house ... I'm posting the menu on my fridge for future reference.

OMG, Banzo. This restaurant, which grew out of the original Banzo food cart, features fresh-made Mediterranean dishes like hummus, falafel, and babaganush. They also have delicious American-style foods like marinated chicken, beef kebab, and Schnitzel.

Banzo's food is so good that you'd almost believe it's not real, but the happy reality is that it Israel. Of course, you know I'm telling the truth -- after all, I Canaan tell a lie. Oman, I'm Mecca-n myself laugh now ... (Thank you, thank you, I'll be here all night).

Banzo's falafel is the first and only falafel I've ever liked (and I tried it many times during the month I spent in Israel). Their specialty chicken is superb -- cooked perfectly and seasoned just right. The pita bread (imported directly from Israel) hits the ball right in the pocket (bad dum ching), the humma-humma-hummus is SO good, and the salads are fresh and flavorful.

On top of their great food, it also happens that Banzo's owners, Aaron and Netalee, are both genuinely great people. I guess that shouldn't be a surprise, though, given what a wonderful restaurant they've brought to the Madison community.

Banzo consistently delivers crispy, flavorful falafel and the creamiest hummus around (how do they do that?). We stopped in for an early dinner on Saturday and I enjoyed the Harvest Platter. The platter came with falafel, grilled eggplant (that was slightly undercooked), hummus/pita, perfectly fluffed rice, and a small salad that could have used a boost of acid and salt. We sat in a cozy purple room that matched the lovely sangria we were sipping on. It was a wonderful way to unwind on a Saturday evening.
Love Banzo! Always a go to when I need a falafel fix. Their hummus is top notch and they have great tabbouleh,  too.
We live in the area and this place is our go-to for takeout and delivery! Absolutely love it :) The hummus is phenomenal. I usually go for the chicken F-bomb platter.

I was tempted to give them a 1 to reduce the length of the line at the food cart every day, even in rain, but that would be a lie.  I'd stand in the rain and cold, and I have, for as long as it takes to get their falafel.  I switch between the sandwich and the platter, but either way I go for the tahini and hot pepper sauce, totally awesome.  Their hummus is very good, though if I am to be honest not quite as good as Mediterranean Cafe, but I can live with that.  I LOVE falafel, this is better than NYC food cart falafel, which has long been my gold standard, and I've eaten a lot of 3am NYC food cart falafel.

Super delicious place that we discovered while visiting Madison back in April before moving here!  They deserve their 4.5 star rating.  This is about as good as it gets for Mediterranean food.  They have a lot of vegan / vegetarian options.  We have their falafel meal plate and split pea soup.  Everything was really delicious.  The atmosphere is super cute and cozy, and the guy, who co-owns the restaurant with his wife, was very genuinely nice.

This is handsdown one of my favorite rrestaurants - not just in Madison but in general! I absolutely love falafel. I was long-awaiting a casual dining alternative to the fancier Bunky's (serves Mediterranean food). I was so excited to discover Banzo. They have 2 amazing vegetarian options - the Harvest (falafel and eggplant) & the Banzo (falafel!). You choose your base entree (ie the Harvest) and then decide whether you want a sandwich or some type of platter. I also live for their baklava!
I am in love with Banzo since the first time I tasted their falafel. I usually get pita one. The taste is consistently delicious.

We got the Groupon for this place, and cashed it in tonight once we realized we had nothing planned for dinner. We'll eat with Banzo again, for sure! Very good sandwiches and sides. My husband got The F-Bomb with chicken, and I got The Harvest. We got sides of falafel and hummus, and each got an iced tea. Everything was GREAT, the service (over the phone) was super friendly and we're especially excited about them moving into the old Vientiane Garden spot on Sherman -- that's just down the road from us, and just a decent dinner walk away!

I really, really love this place. Owner, Netalee, learned to make hummus from her grandmother as a child in Israel. It's a two-day process and the end product is truly amazing.

I've traveled to Israel several times for work, and I've been able to eat some of the finest Mediterranean food you can find anywhere, and Banzo is on par with that. They take great pride in starting with fresh ingredients and not taking shortcuts. They also take pride in ensuring many of their offerings are vegetarian or vegan, and they don't have any processed foods in sight.

Whether you are at the food cart or the main restaurant, you cannot go wrong. The F-bomb pita with chicken on wheat never disappoints, and you get your falafel fix with the two that are included in the pita. The clever pita take-out box is great too!

We live in the neighborhood and have seen many restaurants try to make it in their space that is an old house. They've done a nice job with the space and we LOVE the patio. I was there at 1:00 today and it was hopping. So nice to see Netalee and Aaron putting down roots here.

Mmm this place is such a treasure for the Sherman/Tenny Park area! Natural food, great portions, and just delicious in every way from meats, veggies, and sides. If there is anything I would critique, it would be more seasoning in the babaganoush (sp?), but that can be personalized by your own salt and spice tastes. Give them a try and you won't be disappointed!
My meal was average but I will definitely go back and try something else.  I liked that atmosphere and the wines were very good.

I've eaten at both their food cart and their restaurant, and you can't go wrong with either. Amazing. 

I recently ordered both The Schnitzel and The Chick, opting for a platter and a pita. I shared with someone, and it was plenty of food. Everything was absolutely delicious. I'd recommend getting the platter, because it comes with a good amount of extra food, including rice and hummus. Also, the falafel is fantastic!

This recent order was for delivery, and the person who brought my food was very nice. When I've dined at the actual restaurant, it's always been a pleasant experience. They have a nice space and the staff is friendly.

I've eaten at Banzo about a dozen times and it has always been amazing. Highly recommended!
Order delivery last night via eatstreet. The delivery was prompt and the food quite good. I got a chicken platter with a side of falafel which was quite good. I would highly recommend the falafel!!!

Banzo is my favorite food cart and really introduced me to how good falafals can be. It's a great place to check out during a normal trip to the farmer's market if you go there regularly. The prices are right and sometimes there is a bit of a wait due to the popularity of the place but the wait is worth it! Don't forget to add dressings.

Banzo has, hands down, the best falafel that I have ever eaten. It is light, perfectly crisp, freshly fried, and delivered with delicious tahini sauce. Their hummus is simply superior. If Banzo stuck to serving only products linked to its namesake (garbanzo beans) I would give this restaurant five stars without a thought. 

The Punchline: drop what you are doing and immediately go to Banzo and eat falafel and hummus. Now. It will change your life.

The Proviso: Banzo does attempt to reach out beyond falafel, with less success. Their eggplant is delicious, but sodden with oil. Equally, their chicken suffers from the same vice that plagues most chicken served in Madison: it is over-spiced, and over-cooked.  The chicken is edible, but regrettable. I have not eaten the beef kabob, so I have no opinion on this option. That being said, why would you eat any of this when you can eat the falafel and hummus?

Eat the falafel.
Good food at a reasonable price. The waiter and waitress are very friendly. The hygiene is acceptable in general.  But the dishes, utensil and table are not clean sometimes.

I've only been at the food truck, which is pretty good for the buck.

Both times I've been I ordered their falafel sandwich. The falafel was soft and tasty and the hummus fairly standard. The bread was ok; a bit stale.

7$ for a decent and fulfilling lunch, so I'll go back too Banzo a couple of times a year.
The chicken pita was nice. Nothing spectacular though. A good place to have lunch if you don't have any better options.

I stayed in Madison for over a week, and this was the first and THE BEST meal I had by far. My friend, who is a native to Madison, took me around to all the other famous places Wisconsinites like to eat, but I still kept asking to come back to Banzo. Even after my first visit, the food and the ambiance and the staff left quite an impression on me. The restaurant feels like you are eating in someone's home, the staff is friendly and helpful with first timers trying to figure out what to order, the food came out quickly, and we sat out on the porch and ate, the view and the weather was lovely.

I can't remember the name of what I ordered, but it's one of the most popular platters there according to the staff. The chicken was cooked nice and tender and everything was super flavorful! It came with two crispy falafel balls, not too dry...the best hummus I've ever tasted, nice and thick, I only wish they gave you more, I licked my little bowl clean! Even the SALAD was really flavorful, I'm not quite sure how they did that, and I never tried saffron rice before but it's amazing! Everything on my plate had it's own unique flavor, so that I could move around on my platter and not get bored of what I'm eating, and the portions were perfect, so that everything was good from beginning to end! Can't wait to visit Madison again just so I can eat here!
Food was great, lovely spot to break our road-trip and enjoy fresh & delicious falafel and salad.
F-bomb is my favorite. The meat patties are flavorful. They can be slow.....

I ate there last week and keep craving it. Always a good sign.

We ordered a lot of food to try as much of the menu as we could. That was certainly enough to bring us back. 

The falafel is to die for. Seriously, the tastiest falafel I've ever had. And I've eaten more than my fair share of falafel in life.

The chicken "schnitzel" is a spicy breaded slice of goodness. Sooo good.

Their salad was great, with lots of ingredients and a delicious dressing.

The only thing on the menu that I was not too excited about was the hummus. For my taste it had too little citrus pop and too little garlic. The tahini in the hummus had a great flavor though. Your mileage may vary.

The location is a bit hard to find if you don't know the neighborhood. It's a house that's been converted into a commercial space. They have a nice deck outside that is across from a park. In addition to the small room where you order your food (with only a few tables), there is a larger room with a lot of character that they are still setting up.

I'm looking forward to trying the other items on the menu.

THE F-BOMB PLATTER IS THE EFFING BOMB.

I don't know about you kids, but I know I'm F-ing lazy when it comes to eating out sometimes. This definitely applies to me back when I was in school. So thank the heavens for the Banzo cart which was in Library Mall almost EVERY day. And if it wasn't, their twitter lets you know where they are. I've been to the actual restaurant once and it was just as good. The house is really cute but it's in the middle of nowhere...at least for me, the student/isthmus dweller sans car. 

Back to the F-Bomb: The marinated chicken is a slightly sweet, light, and filling. The falafel balls are fluffy and falafelly, and the chopped salad is inexplicably tasty. What makes a salad special? I don't know, but Banzo's is pretty F-ing good.

The food won't leave you in a state of self loathing or immobile a la food coma. You'll just daydream of falafel balls dancing around your head for the rest of the day.

Ain't no thang.

My friends and I shared a F-bomb sandwich which was good but not amazing. I enjoyed it but maybe bc we got different food from other carts, it didn't stand out compared to the other carts we got. I do recommend this place and say that this place is one of the top 3 carts located here though!

The food here is amazing. We had both the schnitzel and Shwarma platters and they're not afraid to use spice. I would have taken a picture of the great looking dish but it's disappears too quickly. 

Highly recommended. I really wish they had a closer location to campus. They do have food carts but I never make it to them in time.

My first time there and really got excited for baba ganoush. It was nothing even similar to what it's supposed to be. I'm truly offended by how bad it was. It's a tiny menu, there's no excuse.
Baba ganoush is charred and roasted so it's smoky and has tahini in it. And it's smooth... They served me chunky boiled eggplant with no tahini and no flavor. It was awful.
I'm not the only customer who has commented on how bad it is. Guys, try a new strategy and make it correctly and authentically... or rename it - cuz what you served me is not even close. So gross...

Banzo summed up in one word? Delicious. Incredible. Fantastic. 

Okay, three words.

The Banzo food cart serves incredibly fresh and tasty Mediterranean food at a very fair price. I paid $9 for the Banzo platter and was handed a 9x9x3 to-go container filled to the brim with food. All of the food -- from the falafels to the hummus to the salad -- is fresh, prepared perfectly and just bursts with flavor.

The people working are friendly. 

This is my favorite food cart in Madison!

I spent a summer sailing around the Mediterranean so I like to consider myself a falafel connoisseur (I only mean for that to sound pretentious in a sarcastic way), but Banzo is in a league of its own! Its got the perfectly crispy outside and flavorful, smushy inside I can never get quite right in my own kitchen.  All the sauces are awesome (especially together!) and they're certainly not stingy on the toppings. Even if you don't think you're in the mood for Banzo falafel...yes, you are.
Never had a bad meal from Banzo. I love the F-Bomb with chicken and falafel. So yummy. I also love their homemade potato chips.Their delivery was speedy, it only took like 25 minutes to arrive.

I caught Banzo on the tail end of lunch hour during a recent trip to Madison and man am I happy I did. They were out of a lot of stuff (the sure sign of delicious food), but were so good-humored and adventurous about what kind of food they could give me and Corey D that I think I may have enjoyed the random ordering procedure even more than I would have had I just been ordering standardly.

What did I eat? A little bit of a lot of things... falafel, hummus, pita, chips, pickles, and an array of their made-from-scratch sauces. Considering I paid around 7 bucks for this tasty treat in a box I was definitely a happy camper.

The food + the happiness of the workers in the truck = a 5 star experience for me!

Went here to try something different than our normal resturant choices.  We found this place looking on yelp.  Thier reviews were fantastic.  When we pulled up there was construction everywhere going on.  We were confused where this place was.  They had food trucks out back of an old house looking building.  That old house was the resturant.  Once inside and we got a handle on what we were about to eat and how to order it.  We were excited to try.  We both even said worst case scenario if we don't like it we can put it in a box and go.  However, that was not the case folks.  The food was delicious.  I had what was called the F-bomb platter and my wife had some chix pita sandwich.  The F-bomb was some falafel balls and beef kabobs.  Serve with a pita and yogurt sauce along with some hummus.  Not a huge fan of yogurt sauce or the hummus.  However the plate had some good rice and a fresh salad on it.  Impressed to say the least.  My wife's food was filled with flavors.  It was messy, but wonderful.  I would try this place again.  I would have given it a 4 star if it wasn't for the high prices and the terrible construction noises going on outside during our entire lunch.  I will change my review on out next visit.

I was expecting really delicious yummy falafel sand to be honest, I was disappointed.
