It wasn't horrible but certainly not worth the $10 I paid. The pita bread was really good, soft and chewy. The falafel was nice and hot but lacked any sort of flavor. I could have used some salt but unfortunately didn't have any immediately close by  to spice up the meal. The sandwich was served with two sauces that didn't really complement the meal. 

However the young lady who took my order was nice and my meal was ready within a reasonable time. I think I will be on the hunt for a different falafel place the next time I am in Madison.

We agree. The falafel are the best around.  Although their pita is pretty good as well.
Decided to not go out, but order out this Saturday night.  
As Banzo was nearest restaurant on our list, it was the choice.
Ordered the Banzo platter, the f-bomb platter and a side of tabouli.
All were delicious.  The chicken kabobs from the fbomb platter were season just enough to have a kick, but not overwhelm. The salad cooled off the palette, and the falafel are the best.  keep it up.  cucumber sauce is fantastic, just a great spot.
Oh, the pita, light fluffy and so much more in everyway than store bought pita.  Go!!  We'll be back often.

The food tastes good. Like really really good. Why 3 stars? The service is consistently disappointing. Delivery takes really really long and sometimes its hard to get someone to answer the phone. I know that places get slammed, I know orders can take longer when it is busy however I would prefer to be told that the workload is too much to take my order instead of being told it will be 45-an hour and then wait almost two hours for my food that is delivered ice cold. 
Fortunately hummus and the salad are good cold. My chicken and rice still had good flavor but with getting cold the texture was dry.
I refuse to make any employee feel bad, because I know it is tough to know your pissing people off by being behind but seriously, say no to orders when your behind to get caught up and can provide the quality food everyone wants.

Banzo is one of those places that I wake up in the morning and just know that I have to go eat at asap.

Banzo was the place that first introduced me to falafel when I was in college, and they still remain my favorite place to go.

Their falafel pita with all the sauces is amazing. The combination of the Falafel, warm pita, crisp vegetables and crunchy potato chip (yes I said potato chip... you are going to have to trust me on this one) is AMAZING!

I have introduced both my boyfriend and brother to their first falafel through Banzo and I am sure I will continue to introduce friends and family members in years to come!

This place is seriously on-fleek. Normally food trucks tend to be overpriced (or maybe that's in LA where I'm from...) but Banzo really gives you a bang for your buck. For $7 I got the Banzo pita, loaded with 4 large falafel balls, Israeli salad, etc. It was a lot of food for a very good price, which I wasn't expecting. They even gave me the option of whole-wheat pita which is a plus. I believe they also accommodate vegan/gluten-free requests. To top it all off, they handed me my food within ~30 seconds of me ordering. Very convenient and quick, although there was no line when I got there so that may vary.
As someone who's been to Israel and has sampled all kinds of falafel/pita there, this place definitely compares to the authentic falafel stands I've visited on the streets of Tel Aviv. I will be sure to come back here anytime I feel nostalgic for Israel and I know I won't be disappointed.
Really delicious food, but a little salty. Somehow I always end up with a stomach ache after eating their food.

Each time that I've been to banzo I've had a great experience. The food is always fresh and delicious and the people working always have a smile on their face. Between ordering and taking a seat, it usually takes about 15 minutes for you food to hit the table.
Wasn't impressed with the falafel balls a pita was fresh but that was about it. Cucumber sauces tasted sour and bad :/

I love you, falafel.  You are sometimes bland and sometimes overcooked, but at Banzo, dear falafel, you are perfect.  

The hummus was also excellent.  The fries, while they came in a huge serving that I couldn't finish, were delicious.  The only shortcoming with my meal was the salad--I wasn't a fan of the dressing.  It probably didn't help that since I ordered delivery, my salad had been stuck in a container with the hot food, so take that with a grain of salt.

Why am I not surprised to see the perfect score? I had the harvest pita which comes with 2 felafel and a seared eggplant. I can never resist eggplant. And I think form now on I might not be able to resist felafel either.

Those felafel where perfect balls of happiness. Not sure how they make them, but they were perfectly crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside. Sometimes felafel can be a bit dry, bit these ones were perfectly moist and delicious.

Had to wait a bit for it, but I would happily go back and wait all over again just to get another one of those delicious felafel!

Another favorite of ours from our old stomping grounds. Banzo's food is so, so good. The hummus is out of this world (and sold in select grocery stores -- lucky for you). Plus, the falafel, majadra rice, homemade chips and fresh salad are delish! A great place to go if you like supporting local and prefer a down-to-earth vibe.

I love the Banzo platter or Banzo sandwich. The f-bombs are not the best, in my opinion, but I have friends who love them. Both the restaurant and food cart are amazing. Fantastic spin on Mediterranean food. They always make delivery easy as well, which is a big plus.

Banzo has a location off Sherman but also puts a cart down on campus for lunch during the week.  Sometimes its on State but I have also seen it across from Computer Sciences near the geological sciences building.

Anyway, this food is awesome.  Never had anything here I don't like.  The platters are great for kids to share.

Wish they had more expansive hours.

I was so excited when this place opened! Banzo is my favorite food cart by far in downtown Madison, and the food here is no different from their amazing food cart meals! The falafel is amazing, either in platter or pita.

The BEST falafel I have ever had. YUMMMMM. as mentioned in other reviews- perfectly crunchy on the outside and creamy and amazing on the inside.
Had the falafel w/ grilled eggplant in a pita sandwich which was also stuffed w/ a chopped salad and hummus and chips!
the pillowy soft, fresh pita comes all the way from Israel (frozen) then they bake it to make it fresh. fantastic.
My companion had the beef kabob plate- 4 big meatballs of spiced beef- served w/ hummus, chopped salad, tahini and fresh pita.
It was 11 degrees out when I got the falafel craving so we headed to the restaurant on Sherman Ave. What a nice surprise! A cute little bungalow, re-imagined as a cafe where you order in the front room and then head back to a nice warm room filled with about 10 tables. Very cozy and pleasant with a high ceiling and colorful art on the walls. Did I mention Warm? 
confession- I always get the baklava if it is on offer. Housemade and DELISH!! very cinnamony with perfect flakiness and lots of nuts.

I look forward to the spring and summer when I can get some of this food from one of their carts and take it to a sunny spot to enjoy. they also have a nice looking deck/patio at the sherman spot for when the snow melts. If it ever does.

I work downtown, but venture to their Sherman location often because I don't want to bother with the lines at the food truck. I love sitting on the porch, and noshing on their fresh dishes. 

Last time I got the F-bomb sandwich. Everything about it was amazing. It's one of those items that it makes it hard to try anything else on the menu.

Banzo's food is delicious. Their falafel is flavorful and fresh and I love the potato chips on the pita sandwich. They also have a great patio to sit out on during the summer. I only wish they had a bit more indoor seating for those nights when it's not patio weather (most of the year in Madison!)

Upping them to 4 stars. My falafel was, for the most part, quite good, although I've got a handful of suggestions that could easily improve it.

Got the Banzo--$6--and this thing was *loaded* with falafel. I mean, there were balls everywhere (stop thinking now, perverts). Also in the pita: hummus, cucumber/tomato salad, a couple pickles, homemade potato chips and some tahini.

Hummus, from what I could taste, was pretty decent, but nothing special. The thing was a mess and fell apart as I got to the bottom! Obviously, not a complaint from me, because this thing was packed to the brim. The falafel balls themselves, were delicious. The potato chip at the bottom wasn't really crispy--it had become soggy by then. In Israel, cuts of potato are either thick or they're french fries. Salad was pretty basic, but good.

Sauces: chili garlic, tahini, yogurt dill. Still no green sauce! And by green, I mean green zhug--the classic hot pepper hot sauce.

Yogurt dill was tasty, but weird for falafel. Red chili wasn't as thick as I'd like, but still good, and tahini was tahini. Overall? Pretty solid.

Will I be back? Yeah, I think so. I need to try other things. So, here are my suggestions for Banzo:

1) Thicker cuts of potato. Chips are fine on the side, but if it's not thick in the pita, then you don't get any of the flavor--and it loses authenticity.

2) Laffa. Seriously--offer it! More durable than pita and people will pay more. I know I would.

3) Green zhug! It's easy to make, it's spicy, and it's delicious. 

4) They should really offer sabih--the traditional Israeli/Middle Eastern eggplant-in-a-pita dish. I'd buy it.

I'm rambling. Overall? Good. Service? Great. Everyone is so damn nice. I'll go back.

This is OK food played up to a small-town audience wowed by cool packaging and the apparent "exoticness" of chick peas.

If you're near the cart a falafel sandwich is a decent choice though there's often a long line.

Delivery is less recommended. A basic meal for two (two sandwiches and a couple sides) costs almost $30 with delivery charges. Their side sauces are in tiny cups that are only half full and you have to pay for more. Overall I like Banzo but I'd take some of the effusive praise it receives with a grain of salt.

What took me so long to go to the brick and mortar location?  I have been to the food cart before, but this was so much better.  Started with a tasty curry soup and then the F Bomb Platter.  Everything I tasted was delicious.  It is a combination of service / self-service though.  You order at the front counter, they bring your order to you, and you buss your own table.  That didn't bother me though, as the food was so tasty I didn't mind one bit.  

I am reserving the fifth star for more visits - as I only tasted a small portion of the menu - but I have high hopes to be back soon and be even more impressed.

I am in love with this place! I ordered delivery via GrubHub. My food arrived 30 minutes early. The food was packaged perfectly and cooked perfectly too. I had the falafel sandwich with hand-cut chips (and I also ordered salad to eat for the next meal). The falafel was crispy.. The salad in the sandwich was fresh... The potato chips very crispy and not oily at all. 
It's just one of those places that pay attention to details and clearly take pride in their food. Love. Love. Love this place! Please come to DC!

When I think of this place, the words fresh and yum come to mind.  I've visited the physical location and the food carts various times.  Despite the variety of menu, I'm still a sucker for the tasty "Banzo" wrap which is well balanced and fairly filling.  I will recommend eating it sooner than later as the pita's bottom gets a big soggy the longer you wait.   The F-bomb is legit too.  And for the food carts, target lunch on the early side of things as they've often been short of or out of falafel balls - which are obviously a key ingredient.  Enjoy!

Undeniably the best bang for your buck in the city. For under 10 bucks, you can get SO MUCH food, and it's all full of yum. But above all else, I need to pay my respects to the falafel. After going to other restaurants, and trying to make it at home, I can say that I haven't had any falafel comparably as good as Banzo's. It just manages to have more flavor, more crunch, and also isn't nearly as dry as other ones i've had. Basically, it's perfection, and the envy of every other place in town. That, and the fact that I can get it on west and east campus for lunch in addition to their restaurant (which has a great patio area, btw) makes it a top tier place to get a meal.

I grew up in the middle east, eating some of the best and authentic falafels, hummus and tahini. I trust my middle eastern childhood to spot a good falafel and Banzo scores! The first thing I look for in a falafel is for a crunchy exterior with the green goodness of a parsely infused batter. I am more partial to the batter made of Garbanzo beans as opposed to that made with Fava beans.
Banzo gets it bang on with the color and texture. I have had many a falafel in the US with pale interiors due to the absence of the parsley. An authentic looking falafel, Banzo's falafels make you feel good all the way through!. The flavor is near perfect and close to authentic, a bit more parsley and you would be transported into the lands of Arabia!. 

The sandwiches are a perfect complement to the falafel. I often have The Banzo and The Harvest both of which are a burst of color and flavor. I prefer The Harvest, for the addition of the pan seared eggplant slices. Juicy and tender, the perfectly cooked eggplant certainly pairs well with the crunchy falafel. I have had my share of charred eggplant in my sandwich, but I am willing to look over that one isolated incident. Once you have bitten into the sandwich and enjoyed every bit it, the heaviness of the sandwich sinks in!. For $7.95, the Harvest is as good as it can get and satisfying to the T. A personal suggestion would be to buy the sandwich from their food cart or dine in, something is a miss with the sandwich when it is delivered home.

 While their hummus lacks the small yet bold statement made by the tahini added to it (the authentic hummus has tahini play a small yet significant role in its flavor), Banzo's hummus is creamy and delicious. Pair it up with pita chips, or lick it off your fingers, either ways the hummus is truly enjoyable.

Banzo is certainly as authentic as it can get! Crispy and fresh, the plain looking, unassuming food certainly rules your palate with flavor. Banzo manages to appease my longing for middle eastern food without insulting my arabian memories. My only suggestion is if they could add a mint lemonade to the menu, which is traditionally paired with the falafel.

My kebab pita was awesome but my wife's schnitzel was dry & flavorless. Service was fast & friendly. Atmosphere at the Sherman St locale is cool as heck...between the menu & decor, I love that this place does what it wants, and not what is expected.

don't count on their food truck being open when they say it will be or even at the location they post on their social media handles. they really should delete all their social media because it only cuts time out of lunch breaks for people who work on the square, get there only to have the dudes smoking cigs tearing it trying to make a point to simultaneously show you they are cool, but totally not give a crap. 
banzo is run by bogus people.

After trying their Food cart which was delicious i tried the place on sherman with a group of people. The order was messed up we ordered in they had made it to go when we inquired after waiting 30 minutes they just went back and then brought out the cold falafels. It was a bad experience I did not go back until today 6 months later and ordered the falafel and the pita was hard on one side and soft on the other the falafel tasted ok but nothing to rave about. I love falafel and have had it in israel. I hesitate to go back again as Madison needs places like this but I was very disappointed. Doubt i will be back.
Very few places can keep up a high standard of food. This place does it. It is fresh, it is delicious and it does not disappoint. I receive the same quality each and every time I go back.
Amazing!! Blown away. I would reccomend something on the menu, but everything is spectacular. Definetly would try this place!

I had never tried falafel before stumbling across Banzo- it changed my culinary worldview! I love love love their stuff, and they are always so friendly to boot. I just wish they would come back to their previous spot at South campus occasionally where I used to be able to get lunch. Please open a storefront!

*edit* Oh, I see that they do have a stationary location on Sherman Ave., and they deliver! Yay!

I had their food on a food truck one day.  And then I met some friends here for dinner last week.  This is as good as it gets, folks!  Fresh tasting and delicious food.

Not much to say that hasn't already been said.  But overall, everything was just top-notch.

I had been craving good Mediterranean food and was not disappointed at all. You walk in, order at the counter, and then either take-out the food, or sit at one of the tables in the back room. It is pretty small, but a very cute place. Also, they have GREAT gluten-free options (Mostly everything there is gluten-free besides the pita bread, even the falafel). I ordered the F-Bomb platter (half Falafel, half Chicken), and it was awesome. The hummus was very fresh (same with the other sides). 

Nothing bad about this place, at all. Can't wait to go back!

During a recent visit to Madison I stopped at Banzo for diner before heading home to Wausau - it was a great choice! Everything was fresh and delicous!

The falafel really is as tasty as the reviewers say. I got the Banzo pita which was a great deal, a nice large portion. We did the 3 sides for $10 and enjoyed the babaganoush, hummus and couscous tabouli. I think I could eat that couscous tabouli everyday, it was so good!

Banzo was a nice treat that I will take advantage of again when I am visiting Madison.
I am very picky about falafel. This place nails it. We had two f-bomb pita with tahini and hot sauce. Amazing. Seriously eat here. They deliver also which was a welcome find also.

Two years later, I remain obsessed with this Madison gem. You just can't beat their falafel. Half of the time I'm in Madison, I get Banzo and the other half of the time I wish I was eating it.

My favorite will remain the F-Bomb platter. The platter contains the coveted falafel, juicy/flavorful chicken, hummus, cucumber salad and rice. I like the option of white or wheat pita bread...very thoughtful. The tahini and spicy sauces are both perfect additions.

Since last review: Visited their brick and mortar location on Sherman. Great atmosphere -- laid back and comfortable. Patio is nice too.

I had the falafel this weekend and I'm still thinking about it...

Quick review : good on some thing, great one one, and not so great on others. 

Humus and pita bread was great!!!

Beer was good. Yes they have beer and wine but it is not on their menu

The meat was not good. I got the Schnitzel (bread fried chicken) and it was very dry and I did not care for the breading.  

The people I with which I was dining gave good reports, so I bumped this up to a 3 vs. a 2.  I may try again and I will definitely get the humus and pita again (very good).

What is there not to like about Banzo? 
It is exactly what Madison needs more of! I have to honestly say, the best falafel I have ever had.
The pita's they are using go beyond the word "good". More like amazing! Fresh, soft, & tasty making me always asking to come back for more! 
The marinated chicken is fantastic!
The Schnitzel pita is one of favorites! I really enjoy that each bite I take is filled with a new surprise....Is it going to be relish? Chicken? or Tahini sauce...it is all so good.

They have a great outdoor patio also. You can find the perfect amount of shade on a beautiful sunny afternoon day here. Plus, as a added bonus, they always have out fresh cucumber water. It's great!

The staff (and owners) are awesome people, making every experience here better than the last. 

One of my favorite restaurants in Madison!

The food cart is better than the restaurant in my experience. I worked on state street and ate at the food cart almost every day I loved it I always got the harvest. I've been to the restaurant twice and it just doesn't compare. The hummus and pita is always on point. No complaints there best in town that I've had. But the rice and falafel is always cold and hard while the eggplant is really hot. The food truck everything was equally hot and just so good I was seriously addicted
LOVE this place. They have great staff at both the restaurant and food truck. I always get the f bomb with chicken and it's amazing!!! Fresh and always delicious!

Wow! I'm speechless.
Fantastic food...... Best Mediterranean food I've had.
Chicken shawarma F bomb pita... And falafel. To die for...don't miss out.
Food is great but they need to ditch the food cart ethos and hire servers

Oh my god. Amazing falafel. Tasty pita. What more can you ask for?!?! I was so ridiculously full after stuffing my face with this portable awesomeness (aka The Banzo pita sandwich) but boy was I happy. No regrets.

I checked out their indoor location on Sherman Ave. Simply amazing! If you're looking for great Mediterranean in Madison for around $10 (not including drinks/extras) this is the spot to be. My friends and I managed to order different things from the menu and loved all of them.

We've had catering from Banzo at my office several times. A couple times, we each ordered our own meal. In that scenario, I've gotten the banzo pita sandwich, banzo hummus plate, and banzo platter (all are vegan and the "banzo" refers to falaffel.) They mark their vegan options and make it very easy. We've also gotten family-style catering, which was also very vegan-friendly. In fact, it included vegan rice, cous cous salad, falaffel, hummus, and pita, and the only non-vegan item was the chicken they also served. I love their food so much! Some of the best hummus around in my opinion. Thanks for making great food and labeling it clearly! I will always encourage my office to order Banzo for these reasons.

Banzo definitely lived up to it's reviews.  It's worth it to come here just for the falafel alone.  But everything we had was good.  I got the F-bomb in a pita, and my wife got the fbomb hummus platter.  We also tried the fried cauliflower with herbed tahini.  We left full and happy.
Love the flavor this place packs into those little pita pockets! Their meats are seasoned so well. Don't skip on the hummus! It's the best around!

5-star falafels (vegan) and 4 star hummus.  Prices are very cheap for the quality and quantity.  Their lunch-time food truck is the best choice for vegans staying around the capitol square.  We also stopped in at their restaurant location on the way out of town and ate way too much!

I'd give them a 5 star if only they had some type of dessert, preferably vegan, and preferably baklava.
I was there 2 mins before they close... The staff was really nice. The food is pretty good. I forgot to take a photo cause the food looks really good.

I have been here twice in the last few weeks and really enjoyed the food and view the porch seating. They have nice little touches like adding cucumbers to the water. Excellent humus. I have tried the chicken kabobs and brisquit..both were a little salty, but the rest of the meal more than made up for it.

Food : Average with the exception of Falafal

Service : Non Existent as it's a purely help yourself place

A good Mediterranean place is known by a few key things IMO. The hummus, the baba ganoush, the falafel, the pita and the sharwma. This place does serve most of those but not really good ones.

Let's start with the GOOD. The Falafel's were fresh and fried to perfection just to ensure the right chewiness from the chickpeas. Pairing it with a tahini sauce which to me had a hint of Coconut was brilliant! A must try for anyone. The Hummus was very good and again fresh.

Now the REST. The Lamb platter, albeit in the form of Kofta (a version of Meatballs) were dry, somewhat overcooked and lacked a depth of flavor Mediterranean places are otherwise synonymous for!! The sauce was dangerously close to simply being one right out one of Olive Garden recipes for Marinara. The rice accompaniment was chewy and flavorless. The pita as average at best.

What really made a dent in our experience was the average food with an above average price ($15 per platter per person) and a bare bones service. The only thing they did that we didn't was to get our food from the kitchen to the table. That's it. No checking in on how were doing etc etc and taking around 30 mins just to get 2 mains on a almost empty afternoon. If I knew I was going to get Panera Bread service, I'd better pay Panera Bread prices! (By the way, I Love Panera Bread !! )

I know it's tad unfair to compare with past experiences, but we've had MUCH better and authentic Mediterranean food elsewhere. Not worth a second visit this one.

i rarely eat at the same place twice.  
partly cuz madison has so many great places and is always adding more, partly because i live so far away, partly cuz i'm a variety junkie.
but banzo....banzo blows that whole theory out of the water.

i keep going back!  AND i keep ordering the SAME thing!  GAH!  the harvest....friggin' amazing, lemme tell you why:
1. they know how to cook eggplant.
2. they know how to make falafel.  like my indian friend from india who had his own restaurant called ananda's in the dells and i was a server there and basically could've been paid in falafel instead of money it was that good and i've sorta had this little empty place inside ever since it closed [deep breath, pause for nostalgic flashback].  i've tried lots of falafel in lots of places to try to fill that void and have failed.....until now.

For those of you who are looking for a polished restaurant setting, I would stick to the food cart.  Located in a former house, it is definitely a fixer upper.  A curtain hides the kitchen area.  Space heaters are used to heat the room next to where the food is ordered.  While the amenities are pretty bare bones, the previous reviews are are on point.  The falafel is some of the best in Madison.  Hot, crispy with the perfect blend of spices.  As well, their hot sauce is killer.  But when you don't have a few menu items (on a Monday at 11:45 am), you have to get knocked down a star.  While this may have been a one time thing, it is something that needs to be addressed for those customers (ie. Moi) who really have no other reason to cruise the Fordem Ave. corridor but to eat there.....
Great food truck!  I had the F bomb and loved it!  The girl serving me was happy and helpful.

Heads up: Banzo is now set up on the State Street Mall outside University Bookstore and Memorial Library, not on Charter & Dayton. They're usually open 11-2:30 M-F.

I've heard rave reviews about Banzo in local newspapers, and I finally got to try some falafel today...oh my god. Hands down, the best falafel I've ever had. It was so crispy and perfectly seasoned, and then it got all warm and delicious on the inside. And so fresh, I even found part of an actual garbanzo bean inside one of my falafel balls, rather than the usual green mush. AND it was only $3 for 4 of them! Throw in some fruit and veggies, and for me, it was the perfect size for lunch.

Two thumbs up for Banzo. Can't wait to try the chicken pita sandwich and the fries. Om nom nom nom.

Love this place. I ordered F Bomb sandwich and so did my husband. It was awesome. Got a side of hummus and pita. That too was great. Look forward to warmer weather so we can eat outside at their restaurant.

I'm giving Banzo 5 stars because I crave and day dream about their falafel and hummus.

I've been here 5+ times and have had really good service every time and the food is simply prepared but excellent

How to order: 
1. Choose your protein- 
I highly recommend the Banzo, the Schnizel, and the chicken shawarma (when they have it). I'm not crazy about their beef kabas, I don't like the texture, and were a little heavy on the cumin in particular.

2. Choose your preparation- 
My favorite is the hummus plate, but the platter is also good and comes with a salad and rice in addition to hummus. The Salad is huge and has tons of toppings, the dressing, however, is not very flavorful.

They have self-serve water stations that are usually infused with some kind of citrus. Which I think is a nice touch. I'm a sucker for lemon mint water :)

I really like Banzo but they can be inconsistent. I've had the Harvest sandwich made three or four different ways at this point. Also my takeout tonight lacked certain ingredients (like the famous potato chips). The hummus was everywhere and very liquidy. They are good but I'd prefer more consistency!
Banzo falafel is good - no - excellent. Really freaking good. I am happy they exist and deliver. The tabouli was weird - like eating a mint plant. But back to the falafel, so good.

I'll save the suspense - Banzo just became one of my favorite lunch stops in Madison! Wowzers, Shiver My Timbers and Great Googly Moogly this food is FANTASTIC!!! I've never tried this food cart before although I have passed it at least 100 times walking to different eating venues. I fancy myself a "Falafel Aficionado" and have eaten a lot of it (I haven't had anything in Madison that comes close to NYC falafel) and read that a certain sandwich here made a Top 15 to try in Madison. Count me in - I've accepted the mission...

I was greeted immediately and asked what I was ordering. The F-Bomb Pita on a white pita was the choice. Super quick service. Like "Man, that was so fast I think it isn't going to be good because it must be pre-made" quick. I watched the pita get sliced (nice skills!) and watched the entire sandwich get made so I can confirm these are definitely not pre-made. For what its worth I wasn't the only one ordering so I am thinking they are that fast, or close to it, all the time. Very, very good service!

Onto the F-Bomb. It came in a cardboard holder and was piled high with F-Bomb content. I'm a saucy guy (not like that) so got a container of the three sauces offered - white, red and tan (if you get NYC falafel you get the reference). The white was a yogurt sauce that was fantastic. Tan was tahini. I'd say this was my least favorite. It was definitely flavorful just not what I wanted. The red was the chili sauce and it absolutely is an upper-deck home run. The red and white compliment each other nicely. I am assuming the red sauce is made from scratch - well done, Banzo! Well done!

The sandwich had marinated chicken, two falafel balls, an array of vegetables and potato chips. The flavor of the chicken was great - it had depth and tons of impact. Cooked very well and high food cart quality. The falafel were A+. The flavor, consistency, freshness and fried "shell" are perfect.They hold up to the sauce and made me smile. I've had many, many different falafel in Madison and these are by far the best. If we're talking percentage points, Banzo's falafel beat all of the others combined by double figures. I think the sandwich is tough to eat "by hand" so make sure you grab a fork. Eating it with a fork also provides an experience that I don't think you can get if you eat it with your hands. The different layers really hit the mouth differently when eating it. Chicken, vegetables, falafel, vegetables, potato chips... Wait, potato chips? In my falafel sandwich. Who the heck thought this would be a great idea... wait a second... pin my tail and call me a donkey this is great!!! Fresh potato chips that add something you can't find in any other falafel sandwich - CRUNCH! Lastly, the pita has weight, substance and is chewy with hints of charred spots. It all comes together in a way that makes your brain scream to the rest of your body "THIS IS YUMMY - We'll be back!!!". Again, well done Banzo! Well done!

I'm trying to find something bad to say but I can't. The price tag ($8.00) is justified. The portions are good. I haven't found a "genre matching" food cart that comes close on flavor. This is another 5 star food cart!

Banzo adds to the expansive Madison Food Cart scene and I believe they deserve to be known as one of the best. I'll bring my own little gold star for them the next time I come and try one of their other amazing offerings (which will be soon)!

For your fix of falafel and hummus, look to Banzo. They've got a brick and mortar that delivers, plus a couple of food carts. I have yet to stop in to their restaurant, but I've ordered delivery a couple of times and have visited the food cart a couple times as well.

Things that are great:
- Soft, pillowy pita 
- Smooth and flavorful hummus
- Falafel that stays crisp, even when delivery takes awhile
- Introducing pickles on a falafel sandwich into my life
- Really amazing spiced fries that somehow held up through being delivered

In addition to their stellar falafel sandwich options, they've got some really tasty marinated chicken and a few other items that you can deliver to your mouth via pita or in the form of a platter with rice and salad. 

My main small critique is that some serving sizes seem a little off for the cheapest things. The pita sandwiches are huge, but you get literally about a tablespoon of sauce with them in a teeny, tiny cup. Fine for the hot sauce, but such a big serving could definitely use more yogurt so you can have it in every bite. Same with the hummus side. You get an entire container of their amazing hummus, but four small pita slices to go with it. For me, one pita got me through about a third of that amazing hummus. 

I now know to order extra pita and sauce, but considering the serving sizes it'd be great if the order just came with enough to begin with.

Horrible service.....kept putting me on hold or not answering or hanging up on me. Finally placed order to rude girl and food when arrived was terrible. My fried chicken platter was burnt....the baklava 'a were dried out. And they were out of many things when I placed my order. Refunded me for burnt chic but not nasty baklava or disgusting babaganoosh. Will never order from here again and I suggest you don't unless you enjoy poor quality service and food!
Terrific falafel + delivery = awesome

I may be a little bit embarrassed to admit that in my 4 years at UW, I've never went to the Banzo food cart on Library Mall, and the only times I've had Banzo is when they catered! On the plus side, I did have Banzo catering twice :) 

Their rice, hummus and falafel is A.M.A.Z.I.NG. I wish I could have a giant tray of their falafels with me at ALL TIMES to snack on. They're so crunchy and fresh and flavorful and I could go on and on about them! 

Once I go to their food cart, I'll have to post an updated review. But for now, just take my word that their catering is so good, I would absolutely have them cater to any of my events!

No reviews have mentioned the "Schnitzel", which is chicken breast pounded in delicious breading, then fried - like Weiner Schnitzel is made, except with chicken! I had it in the Salad configuration, and it was absolutely delicious! I'm sure it would be wonderful in the other offerings as well.

I love the falafel ("Banzo"), but I've also ordered the "Chick" and "Slider", and now the "Schnitzel", and I only write to emphasize that it's not just the falafel that makes this my new favorite place for take-out/delivery!
Have never been disappointed here at Banzo or their food cart.  Simply fresh, housemade ingredients.  If you're craving Mediterranean, Banzo's the only place to go in my opinion!!
Went to the restaurant location on Sherman. Excellent falafel and hummus

The falafel and other vegetarian items may be good here, but the brisket salad was awful and should be taken off the menu. It was terribly salty. Also there were not many olives or cheese on my salad. I thought it was overpriced for what I got.

The best thing about this restaurant is its outdoors porch dining. I will not return.

Went here with a  friend a few weeks ago for dinner. The food was fantastic.  I ordered the platter with falafel and eggplant.  The falafels were delicious and flavored well.  The eggplants was great to dip in the homemade hummus, which was also tasty.  The weakest part of the dish was the side salad, which was a little bland/plain.  Service was fast, even for a Friday night.  I will definitely be coming back here again.
The best restaurant food I've eaten to date in Madison. The falafel is absolutely heavenly! A MUST TRY!

I really like Banzo. The food is fresh, tasty, and reasonably well-priced. Their pita is out of this world. 

I'd like to give this place five stars, but there are a few things holding me back:

- What they call "brisket" is not what anyone would reasonably expect brisket to be. It's more of a dry, pastrami-like smoked meat. To be honest, it's pretty nasty. 

- They don't give you enough pita with the hummus plate or side of baba ganoush. 

- They have three really tasty sauces. If you order at the cart, you can douse your sandwich to your heart's content. If you order delivery, though, you only get one tiny little cup of each of them. Given how the sandwich is constructed, it just doesn't work. You take one bite and the sauce is gone. Total buzzkill. 

- Nutrition information would be really nice. I never know if falafel is a healthy option or a calorie bomb.

I have walked past the Banzo trailer for months without even knowing about the goodness that is the F-bomb. (I have to admit I thought they were selling those pork buns because their logo looks like that.) Finally, after reading tons of adoring reviews  I ordered the F-bomb pita with chicken. It 100% lived up to it's five-star reputation. The falafel was bursting with garlicky spice flavors and the cabbage added a nice, crunchy texture. I have to say that the falafel out-shined the chicken here. The chili sauce you can add yourself delivered a zingy kick and the tahini dill sauce cooled things down. It was a filling and convenient meal for $8.
Highly recommended for all Mideast food enthusiasts.  Even the falafel tastes good when cooled to room temperature.  The tabbouleh is fresh.

Have eaten here many a time.  I used to get it delivered at my old job, and then recently was lucky enough to work only 1 block away.  Would visit once a week or so and get the Chicken Pita.  A great flavored grilled chicken, I ordered it with the whole wheat pita.  Topped with some cucumber sauce and hot garlic chili sauce makes it perfect.

Would highly recommend it!  Reasonably priced at $8 for a whole pita.

Let me preface this by saying I have only ever ordered from their food card or delivery. And that I consistently hear good things about this place from people I know in the food industry. And they seem like really nice folks. And so please take this with that grain of salt. 

I've tried, Banzo. I really did. I want to like you. I hear you are great. But you keep letting me down. Did I do something wrong?  The falafel was rock hard and dry once, and burnt the next time. The tabouli was horribly unbalanced and swimming in oil. The tsatziki was bland, and the tahini was.. salty? I think I have caught these guys on bad days.  

But the staff is super nice, the prices are reasonable, and it smells amazing. I can tell my falafel would have been delicious if it was not stale/burnt. I think perhaps this is a gem where you should not order it delivery, and stick to the restaurant rather than the cart.
Banzo's chicken is so flavorful and tasty! I loved everything about the Chick Platter - from the chips, to the hummus, rice and salad and the whole wheat pita bread.

Overall the food itself was great. However, the amount of food for the price was not.

The sandwiches are decently sized but the platters comes with very little rice and pita. It's a good choice if you're looking to splurge, but not if you're looking for a quick cheap lunch.
Great f-bomb as usual. Great hummus. Took a while for meal to come and wasn't busy. Madison staple.

Super delicious. I prefer the restaurant over the cart--it seemed more fresh--but it is a lot more food because they don't do half orders. Staff at the restaurant are very friendly and patient with people new to Banko's. I'd recommend the F-bomb platter--that way you get to sample everything.

Eh...overcooked, tough schnitzel. Bland salad could use some salt, oil, and lemon. It also came with 3 cc of yogurt and 3 cc of tahini in some very small condiment cups (that's 0.101442068 US fluid ounces for those of you who prefer freedom units). I also got one and a half chips, which was a nice added touch. Boring but ultimately palatable. Delivery was free.
Between the adorable outdoor seating area, friendly staff, and outstanding falafel, Banzo is an easy Madison favorite.

Easy review...  The f-bomb with chicken was awesomely tasty!  Perfect place for lunch!  Fast and friendly service.  I ordered the pita the other two in my group ordered platters and we all walked away satisfied.

I've been to the food cart a handful of times. Food is always quality and you get a good mix of textures and flavors in the pita sandwiches - crunchy salad and chips, smooth hummas, soft-on-the-inside-crunchy-on-the-outside falafel (or tender chicken or both), and some nice acidity via the pickles. It's really everything you could ask for in a quick filling lunch sandwich. The only downside is that it doesn't magically appear whenever I need to fill my belly during the day.

Overlooking lake Manona is this authentic cuisine, serving food with the right amount of Mediterranean spice. Amazing ambience with happy staff and customers. Treat for humus and Baba-ganoosh lovers!!
Four stars for pricy food otherwise it deserves five.

Had "The Harvest" today at the Farmer's Market. It was very delicious. The only downside was the two boys in the truck were not prepared for the rush they got and the service was incredibly slow. The flavor was worth the wait, though.

If someone were to ask me about the best thing I've recently ate, I'd say it's Banzo's falafel. 
I didn't have them in pita. Just the balls a la carte.
Now I get why people love this place. These super fluffy inside, crispy-outside falafel are the best that I've ever had anywhere. I thought I had sampled some of the finest falafel a from SF Bay Area to Paris, but I am happy to report that Banzo's falafel wins the title of "the best."
Love it! It's a nice quick, inexpensive & tasty. I love hear the staff try to figure out ways to attract more hipsters.

I've eaten here about ten times since they opened on Sherman, and this was the first time they made a mistake on my order. It hardly mattered. The food is uniformly divine, and I cleaned my plate anyway.

The Chick platter is my go-to favorite. The chicken chunks are all meat, well flavored without a hint of greasiness, the saffron rice and lentils subtly spiced and comforting, the chopped salad with shredded cabbage, lettuce, diced tomato and cucumber with a light vinaigrette is refreshingly crisp, the pita bread crusty outside and tender within, and the butter-smooth hummus is simply off the chain delicious. Tzatziki and spicy hot pepper sauce are great add ins if that's your thing (it's my thing).

The beer selections are nice, and there are a million other soft drink options. You order at the counter, which keeps the price low. It's a small space, and was full when I arrived at 8 pm on Thursday night. However, I was soon (within 5 minutes) seated at a table for two in the corner, which was perfect. The lighting is low but not too low, music is a mix of Mediterranean and eclectic, and is kept at a medium/low volume, adding to the relaxing aura of the place.

Fresh, delicious healthy dinner, low price, friendly staff that doesn't hover. Doesn't get much better.

Best hummus and falafel around town!  If you want a really great place for lunch, you've got to check Banzo out!  The food is very fresh and service is speedy.  It is a self serve place, where you order up at the counter and seat yourself.  It is one of those places you don't go to for the service, but rather for the authentic, delicious food!  There is something for everyone and I guarantee you won't leave hungry!  Also, this place is one of those places you would snap pictures for instagram, lovely flowers outside and just a cute little artsy-hole in the wall place.  Totally reminds me of what Madison is all about!!

MMmmm!  Banzo aims to please and does so wonderfully!  Their cute little restaurant on Sherman Ave is adorable and now serves wine!  The owners are always coming up with exciting specials that always taste delicious.  The pita wraps are all tasty and very filling.

I've had the food cart food a few times. The hummus is pretty darn delish. There sauces are really great and a must to add to your take-out. I'm also a fan of their falafel too. Crunchy on the outside and plenty of flavor bursting on the inside. I like that they have 'plate or sammie' options. The only thing is that the lines for food can get pretty long and sometimes it's impossible to wait for your food during your lunch break. The service has always been on point. Usually it's about $7-10 for lunch.

I have to admit, I never really got the hype about falafel until today. It's always been mediocre in my opinion. So when I heard all about banzo and the hype around it, it wasn't my first food cart of choice. 

Which makes me sad. Because today's f-bomb was f-bomb drop worthy amazing. It's a great combination of falafel AND chicken, so you don't have to fully commit to the falafel. The pickles, the yogurt sauce and the hot sauce... all intertwined with the salad, chicken and falafel... wow. Get it. Please get it. 

The full portion left a very hungry me perfectly satisfied. Not to full, yet not still hungry. Lunch nirvana.

Also to note, if you don't dig spicy, lay off the hot sauce. It can be overwhelming if you don't dig spicy.

Great food cart fair!

I used to get this when I worked on campus -- the food cart is awesome and they post their location on twitter.

Ate a whole lot of Banzo over a 3 year period, due to everyone at my work loving it. I while, not thrilled at first, started to come around to the flavors of Banzo. Eventually I even came to somewhat enjoy my Banzo, and now I can officially say that Banzo is A-OK.

I was in the mood for something light and heaven forbid, semi-healthy.  Blasphemy, I know, especially in the cheese and beer capital of the US but it does happen, I suppose.

Thanks to Sarajane's post, I ordered the Chick platter with salad.  It was a towering plate of salad with greek olives, feta, mixed greens, cucumbers, chickpeas and all sorts of other goodies.  The chicken itself would have been a great meal but mixing it with the salad was super satisfying!!  

It was the perfect day to sit on their porch and bask in the late September sunshine.  Where else can you find a deck like this?  The service was also very friendly.  They were willing to explain to us exactly what we were ordering, and the food came out quick.  

Yeah, it is nummy.  No arguing that.

Where do I even begin?!  Other than to say they have the best hummus...EVER!  And the falafel is so tasty and delish.  Probably the best I have ever eaten too.  I've never gone to the outdoor cart but I have ordered quite a few times from the restaurant on Sherman Ave.  Every time the order is hot, fresh and tastes superb.  I've recruited a few people to try Bonzos and they love it now too!  If this place is not on your to-do list, it should be!  Come on...text your friends, tell them to meet you there. Go.  Do it.  Now.

My friend and I stopped in Saturday afternoon after a 30 mile bike ride.  I had only ever eaten from the famous bright green food cart or ordered Eat Street delivery.  
The outdoor porch was the perfect spot to not only lock up our bikes and keep an eye on them; but the shaded breezy deck was just the reprieve we were seeking! Apparently all the other five groups of biking friends who followed after us had the same idea!! 
As we walked inside the allure of what was to come intrigued my friend (first time "Bazo-er") In spite of the busyness at the time of our visit, our orders were taken promptly by an angel faced young lady at the counter and she told us to seat ourselves anywhere outside and they'd bring our food when it was ready. 
We found a great table by our bikes and helped ourselves to the delicious fruited water which was in a self-serve canister outside as well as inside. It was exhilarating; possibly more so after the 30 mile ride but hey... AÈ stato delizioso! 
About ten minutes later our Herculean plates arrived! (See pic) we both ordered the "F bomb platter" and it did NOT disappoint! The marinated chicken was spot on, the fresh chopped salad crunch and lightly dressed, the snappy lightly seasoned homemade crisps, celebrated hummus, and aromatic rice and lentil pilaf..all ambrosial; and the star of the platter in my humble opinion- the falafel-two perfectly golden brown, crunchy, seasoned, golden stellar flavored falafel! Oh, and the half pita was the best homemade pita ever had!! 
Every last bite savored and relished. 
Highly recommend Banzo and Shuk (the later is temporarily closed/only doing catering currently) 
They have never let me down; food is consistently fresh, delicious, and will leave you craving your next time I promise!

Madison being a college town, I didn't have high expectations for the food here. And generally speaking, I think my lowish expectations were appropriate. However, it's good to be pleasantly surprised sometimes, and Banzo did the job for me. They didn't provide the best falafel that I've ever had, and they had to take some necessary food truck shortcuts (like not cooking to order), but the falafel was tasty and the service was good. Banzo dished my first and arguably best meal in town.

I've tried the food cart a few times in the past, but recently used them for catering. We had their salad option, which included chicken, falafel, mixed greens, hummus & pita wedges, dressing, olives and a chopped salad. Other than the fact most were confused about what to do with the options (does the chopped salad sit on its own or belong on top of something), it was a hit as a light, savory lunch. The smells mezmerized everyone. Delivery was prompt and professional, and price was good. I'd use them again, especially when there is a significant number of vegetarian folks. They always get the short end of the catering stick, and this was a nice treat for them. The meat eaters were happy with the flavorful chicken and everything was nice and warm when delivered, without getting soggy (my fear).

Yes, yes, and yes! Lunch at Bonzo has never disappointed me, and today was absolutely THE best execution and taste of food at this hidden gem. You could actually taste how fresh the lemon was in the tahini sauce, they have the most savory and moist falafel balls anywhere. They are so fresh they're green inside! I'm pretty sure they're green in color from the spices or herbs that are used, but it gives a fun impression of freshness that actually translates truthfully through the taste of the food. I took a little video of the hummus because I thought the artistic nature of the presentation was so cool (maybe they didn't even think of it in the kitchen but the way the food looks as you are eating it actually is really aesthetically pleasing). 
Until next time!

The best place in madison to get med food. I get the F-Bomb every time and it is absolutely delicious. It's a lovely little restaurant with just a couple tables giving it an intimate feel to it. The staff are always incredibly friendly and helpful! I would recommend without a doubt, I think it is absolutely perfect and a great example of Madison's culture.

Just days ago I swore off takeout food. I'm a pretty healthy, whole-food eater and it seems like whenever I order out it's a) not *really* what I wanted and b) a ticket to the sodium spiral of doom where within minutes I feel like a slug that someone has poured salt over, followed by a day-long stomach ache as punishment for my sins.

Another late work night led me back to campusfood for one final foray. I saw Banzo as a new listing and decided to give it a go. Heck with it, I even ordered fries. This never turns out well, so I might as well go down in glory. I also ordered the chick pita sandwich...still being a slave to healthy eating conscience.

My order arrived quickly, well within the 45 minutes I'd been quoted. The delivery guy was super nice (eye contact is a big thing with me, and I worry when people who handle my food won't give it). But by far the most outstanding part was the food itself.

The combo of ingredients on the pita was definitely not something I'd have thought of on my own. I was a little concerned initially with adding chips to the sandwich itself, but they weren't soggy like they could have been if my food had sat around for long. And the box is a super cool method of delivery. I didn't need to transport it much further than bag to mouth, but it helped keep the heaping bundle of yummy in control.

Much to my surprise, the hand cut fries WEREN'T greasy or too salty! They had a great combo of spices--I didn't even bother with dipping sauces, though I did try a little of the ones provided.

The only complaint I can even come up with is that I ordered the hot sauce and it wasn't very hot. There were jalapeno pieces in it, but they were pretty tame. That said, I have an iron mouth, so maybe for everyone else it's hot. Though now that I think back on it, I don't know if I would have wanted it hotter. 

So campufood.com, thank Banzo for saving you a customer. I think they're my new Thursday ritual!

I'm giving Banzo 5 stars even though their customer service sucks - see their response to my first review where I'm told to order again but given no incentive (discount? Free dessert? Can of soda?? Just hint that I matter) to do so -  because Madison's food scene is terrible but Banzo is actually good. Not good for Madison but legitimately flavorful, and they're consistent. 

I really don't like giving them my money because I'm used to places that want you to come back, but when you're desperate for well-spiced, healthy-ish food, Banzo is one of the few places you can count on in the city. So you win Banzo, by virtue of being a big fish in a small, unseasoned chicken pond. 

Don't order the hummus plate, ever, and you'll be fine.
This is the best Mediterranean food in Madison. It also has the best Hummus and falafel I have ever had.

OMG how have I not reviewed Banzo till now. I have dreams about their amazing falafel. I've only ever eaten the falafel pita and only from the Banzo cart that used to be by Union South. Soooo authentic and delicious, and very fresh. And the sandwich is huge! Highly recommended!

My encounter with Banzo was inspired solely on a craving for falafel and a whim as I passed their food cart on Dayton St. They only take cash -- so I had to defer but I'm glad my craving won out and I stopped by.

The falafel was crisp without being burnt and exactly the right flavor that good falafel should be-- you could taste the chick peas clearly, the spicing was noticeable, great, but not overpowering so it ultimately balanced out very well. It was also decidedly inexpensive. I don't know that it made the food taste better but it definitely makes me feel better about indulging!

I also ordered their chicken pita (just a half so I didn't explode) and that was every bit as good as the falafel. They didn't overload it with vegetables, just enough so that you got a little bit of the vegetables, you got their marinade (which is amazing), and the chicken. No ingredient felt like it was "just there"... it all worked together. The chicken, flavor aside, was delightfully tender.

All this from a cart, no less.

Needless to say I will *definitely* be coming back again.
Delicious.. Amazing falafel and "the chick" pita. Can't wait to try everything else.... Extra hot sauce and tahini sauce please!

I had the Harvest platter and I hate to say it but I wasn't impressed. Maybe I went into it with too high of expectations given the past reviews. I felt the hummus had too much tahini and not enough other flavors and the falafel was over cooked. Furthermore, I wish they gave me more pita bread. The chili sauce was good though. Price wasn't terrible, but I just didn't think the quality was worth it. I probably won't buy from here again.

Mmmm, Banzo is my favorite food cart in Madison! 

Both the falafel platter and pita are delish! The platter comes with falafel (duh) plus salad and hummus. Both are amazing, and you can have them put all three of their delicious sauces on the platter. Yum! They serve the sandwich in a cool little box....pop open the top and eat! 

Just found out via other Yelp review that they have a brick and mortar establishment. I must go!!!!
One of the best food trucks in town. Their falafel is gluten-free and they've given me a side of greens instead of a pita. Also, they deliver. Awesome! Keep it up!

I'm no falafel expert, but this is the best falafel I have ever had ever.  I'm not exaggerating and I'm not getting paid.  Crispy on the outside, flavorful, fresh flavor.  Not to mention the baba ganouj, the hummous.

There's no place like Banzo in Madison. From the homie atmosphere (the restaurant is literally in a house) to the great lit up deck to they're amazing food! No other place will satisfy your falafel craving like Banzo does.

Good food. We were driving through Madison and I was craving middle eastern food. Trusting my fellow yelpers, we headed to Banzo. I had the falafel platter and loved it. The hummus was outstanding. So was the fried eggplant. Really outstanding. I was a little disappointed with the rice though. It was a little dry. But overall a good platter. My son ordered the F Bomb and enjoyed his pita sandwich. My husband got the beef in pita and I am not sure if he enjoyed it as much as I thought or if he was humoring me and my falafel craviing. Anyway, it was a good place to stop. Lucky Madison! But the restaurant was underheated and cold. I get it that Banzo was built on food trucks but people who are coming to dine in want a little more comfort.

Just got lunch carry-out and it was awesome. Ordered the two pita sandwiches for $10 special and the three sides for $10 special. The  sandwiches were huge, the four felafel balls per sandwich were delicious as were the pitas and all ingredients, all FRESH and made while you wait. The hummus and babaganush and felafel balls sides with extra pitas were a meal for 2 in themselves. Located directly across from an enormous park...perfect place for a picnic or a date! Wonderful!

First time trying and had it delivered. The presentation looks amazing and the entree was so good! The site said it will take an hour to deliver but they showed up in 30 minutes!! Wow! Highly recommend! Will order again! ;)

This is a great place to enjoy a delicious lunch. Falafel is the best I've had in Madison and the menu, while not expansive, is packed with tasty variations on Mediterranean treats.

Low points - I'm not a fan of the baba ganoush, recipe is a little bland for my taste. Beef patties in pita can be a little on the dry side, same with the brisket. 

High points - pretty much everything else! The chicken shawarma in particular is moist, flavorful, and consistently great! The hummus is straightforward but very well executed with a perfect consistency. The pita is unbelievable and rumor has it its imported from Israel (which is a little tough to believe, but it's great in any event). Very comfortable and welcoming location with attentive staff and both inside and patio seating.

Love it. Will return often. Highly recommended!

My husband and I had recently moved into the neighborhood and still had no food in the house, so we decided to grab lunch from Banzo. I had the Banzo pita and my husband had the F-Bomb pita with kebab. They were HUGE! But most importantly delicious. I devoured the entire thing, even though one sandwich was enough food for two people. I will definitely be back, especially since it's just a quick walk away...and if I walk there that means I can gorge myself, right?
No long review needed. Just eat here. Now. Seriously. Are you eating falafel yet? Is it awesome? Are your fries perfectly crispy and delicious? Yep, I thought so.

Oh Banzo, you kindled my love of falafel and changed my mind about hummus. This is one of my favorite take out joints, but the Patio here In the summer is great. 
I spent my whole life hating hummus. It was that weird gritty goo that my friends' hippie parents would try to pawn off as a snack. A few years ago, I was feeling brave and lazy so I didn't ask them to hold the hummus on my pits sandwich, and that was one of the better decisions I made that year. Banzo's hummus is a beautiful silky garlic-y sauce that compliments their falafel perfectly. Their falafel are basically perfect on their own, but the hummus takes it over the top. 
I believe this location delivers to the near east side, so if you want delivery or take out this is a great non-Chinese option.

Best Mediterranean I've had in Madison so far. Get the F-Bomb, my personal favorite. Very unique Americanized versions of Mediterranean dishes. 

Love the location. Burrows Park right across Sherman - the quieter part of Sherman. And big ups on the patio. Can't say enough about a good patio. Good place to go for a cheap bite and relax!

Banzo is the best restaurant in Madison. I wish I could give it a sixth star. It isn't anything fancy, and the pitas stuffed with enormous falafel balls can almost be difficult to eat, but the experience is completely justified by how delicious everything tastes. You can tell they pride themselves on the fresh ingredients and authentic flavors. I probably eat here at least once or twice a month.

What is Banzo? Probably Madison's best Israeli (and in my opinion, Middle Eastern) restaurant. The Felaffel is great as is the Shwarma. What I'd really like is to keep it more Israeli style. Don't be afraid to hide our roots, which it seems at times too many Israelis are willing to do. Also, as far as Authentic goes, add Limonona and Hafuch. Anyone who's ever lived in Israel knows what this is and Madisonians need to get in the bandwagon.

The food is consistently delicious & the service is friendly & efficient. A bunch of sweet hearts run this joint!! The sweet potato falafel is incredible & they cater to dietary restrictions for all the gluten-free vegans out there. Enjoy!! It's so good!!

Best felafel in Madison my a very large margin. Their felafel and grilled eggplant sandwich is divine! In fact, it's so good that I've never even bothered to try anything else on the menu. It is a perfect sandwich.

Can't believe it's taken me so very long to try Banzo's falafels. I visited the cart at Library Mall. I've read so many wonderful raving reviews I decided I had better give them a try. I ordered the traditional falafel in pita bread. I was so disappointed. Ok, I'll start with the positive. The falafel balls were delightfully soft and moist inside. There was plenty of toppings included in the sandwich, like chopped salad, pickles, and your choice of sauce (yogurt, hot sauce, or tahini). My complaint: salty..... very, very salty falafels. I don't know if this was a fluke, or the norm. I kept hoping that biting into the plentiful garnishes would help disguise the saltiness, but no luck. I didn't find the usual contrasting flavors between the fried ball and condiments. Usually there's that happy dance of complementary differing flavors, but my taste buds never found that. Kept looking for the bright tangy accents. Salty falafel balls, salty pickles, and even salty chips were buried amongst the garnishes. But, hey, everyone else loves these guys though!

I finally tried it!

The falafel is to die for, the hummus pretty good, and the salad/rice is standard. Overall, very affordable and tasty. I can tell why everyone loves it here.

I didn't love the eggplant; it was a bit greasy and tasted bitter.

The guy who rang me up was very helpful and friendly. I think it would be fun to stop back with friends and make a night of it. When I stopped by, I just grabbed lunch to go.

Definitely check it out. This place is a Madison staple. And vegetarian galore.

Yummy, yummy! Stopped here on my way to class and had their falafel pita, called "The Banzo." Falafel and pita were just perfect. They put pickles and homemade chips in the pita with a chopped salad that was cucumber, onion, tomato... and some other crunchy yumminess. Tahini and hot sauce to top it off. Wowie was good!! Oh, plus the fellas working there are super duper cute & sexy...
Really good healthy food from a food truck on the square...Prices are good and service is quick!!  I will be back!!

I ordered the Banzo pita sandwich and hand-cut fries... both were delicious. Probably the best falafel in Madison. The pita sandwich is way worth the $7. It is huge, the falafels are huge. it served as lunch and dinner for me. The fries were excellent as well. They were warm and crispy even though I got my food via delivery. The delivery dude was also very friendly and prompt. Bottom line: eat here.

Wow!  Super good food.  Our first time at Banzo.  My hubby went with the F-Bomb and I did the Chicken platter and followed up with a super soft Tahini cookie.  Super yummy.  We are on the patio to soak up the last few days left to do this in 2016.  Looking forward to our next visit.

Overall experience - 3 stars

We went on a Saturday afternoon, place was empty and everything is self serve kind of setting, you order at the counter with the menu written behind them on a chalk board. I was confused when I was asked tip before I even had my order, coz tip is something which I will decide how much I want to give based on the food and service I received. After that you can just find any empty seat inside or outside the restaurant at your convenience. The side order came in like 20 mins of wait and a few mins after that we were served our entrees. I did like part where you can grab your own cutlery, napkins and water. 
 
Now the food -

Falafel balls - 5 stars! loved them! Very fresh, crispy, perfect flavor and they came with a nice sauce pairing. 

Entree dish - lamb kofta platter 

$15 for the platter which includes 4 small flat lamb meatball/patty with mild tomato gravy, hummus, rice, salad, pita and chips 
I loved the hummus! Very homemade kind of a flavor. Lamb meat had nice flavor but didn't taste like Mediterranean which you would expect to have from a restaurant which served Mediterranean cuisine, it was just a lamb meatball with tomato gravy similar to marinara sauce. Pita was ok, the yellow rice served was tough, salad served was no big deal. The whole time while eating, we were the only ones in the restaurant sitting inside, and no one even once came to check up on us to see whether we need anything or the food is ok. Overall an OK experience. Would definitely give them another try for the swarma chicken and more falafel.

In the maze and confusion of food carts on Library Mall, it is easy to get lost in deciding which one to check out. That is, until you look over and realize that twice as many people are crowded around Banzo as compared with the other food options....Banzo it is!

After looking over the menu briefly, I settled on the "F-Bomb", which is a whole wheat pita sandwich of 2 falafel balls, grilled chicken, chopped salad, yogurt sauce, and tahini. Boy. I chose wisely. 

The falafel had a great taste to it and was hearty on its own, but when combined with the grilled chicken this became quite the delicious meal. The chopped salad of sorts and the various sauces that are added in complimented the marriage of the flavorfully satisfying falafel and stick-to-your-ribs chicken. 

This is the kind of food that you will insatiably, randomly crave. You've been warned.

Excellent falafel.   We had ours walking around capital square at the Farmers Market.  They will sell out.  They sold 150 by the time we got there and got the last few.  Delicious.    Today they were near Pinknew and King by walgreens.
I love these guys! They are so nice and the food is amazing. Not too expensive, either, and they always give samples! :)

I lived for a few months in the Netherlands, and came back for few visits for some breaks and became a fan of doner kebab. Too bad, I couldn't find anything close to it here. But today, I gave Banzo a try (I had the F-Bomb with all the sauces) and IT WAS GOOD. 
I guess I will come to have it more often and  can see myself as a regular.

Too bad the service a bit sucked.  While the waiter was fine, the cashier was not friendly at all, while I tipped them quite generously :D :D Oh well, it may have been one of those days.

Today, I bought the second one. This time I got myself the Kebab. 
It's good but the F-Bomb is still THE BOMB. Now, I made up my mind: I will only get myself the F-BOMB. 

By the way, the cashier is another woman who is SUPER FRIENDLY. They should keep her!!!!! :))

Yelp didn't let me check in, the message said: I was too far away from that. Well, I only went to the truck at the library Mall.

So, yeah. I gave Banzo: 5 stars!!!!!

Love Banzo's falafal pita. A very filling pita with just the right amount of ingredients. And their lunch special is a great value. 

My wife and I have also ordered the F'Bomb, both the chicken and the beef patties, as a platter as well as the lentil soup. Most times the rice is very good but we have had a few times where the rice was a tad dry and flavorless. The hummus has always been consistently good and the option for a wheat pita is a definite plus. Most of the staff is pretty attentive aside from maybe one hostess/waitress whom I have experienced on several occasions having a personal conversation on the company phone in front of customers waiting to order. Very unprofessional. 

They always have some catchy tunes playing in the inside dining area. The outside dining area provides a spectacular sunset view.

Take out has been a breeze as has been delivery.

Would rate them higher if there was more consistency with quality and professionalism.

My husband has been looking for new places to try lately, and today we tried Banzo for lunch. The restaurant is a super cute converted house with an extensive and lovely patio. The folks working there were all super friendly and nice, and I was all like, "I'll have what you're having" about it.
So we both ordered the Banzo, which is a falafel extravaganza served pretty much however you could want it. We also shared an order of their incredible fries, which I'm told is an employee favorite on Fridays, which is as we all know is named after the goddess of deep frying. I'm pretty sure that's what I'm remembering from all those world religion books I have on the shelf.
Anyway.... these folks know how to french a fry. Skin-on, and most assuredly double-fried as Alton Brown has taught us. These geniuses then toss them in a mix of what I personally believe to be salt, pepper, dried thyme and smoked paprika. Most yummy.
Their falafel happens to be one of the best I've ever tasted, outside of my own. Perfectly golden brown and lovingly seasoned. There's a lovely fresh slaw consisting of cabbage, red peppers, pickles, onion, basil and cilantro, as I recall. They make a fine, light hummus to go with everything. I had the pita (my to go container is calling my name even now), while Brett had the platter, which features a yummy scoop of rice that I suspect is flavored with saffron and cinnamon and pine nuts. So good.
Banzo also operates a food truck, so if you see it, run right towards it and get your order in. The restaurant on Sherman is friendly and light and is an "order at the counter" experience. Love them, love their food.
Had to add a follow-up... their falafel pita is a magical dish. After letting the leftover half sit in the fridge for a few hours it became EVEN TASTIER. The seasonings in the falafel were more pronounced than when it was first brought to the table. That's how seeds and such work, but obviously, I was so enamored I had to write this paragraph. These folks know how to make tasty food.

I had been wanting to try this place ever since I had the falafel from Taste of Madison! Saturday I got my chance. I ordered the F Bomb Platter with a glass of iced tea and everything was truly delicious. They have, hands down the best falafel that I have tried. The chicken shwerma was really good, along with the rice it is served with. The rice also contains lentils,which I really like. The platter is also served with a small salad and very soft pita and smoooooooth humus. The iced tea is awesome. Nope, not one bad thing can I think of...go there...soon

ASTOUNDING falafel. Just how my friend's mom used to make it. Perfect texture- not dry, crumbly, or hard. Moist and just right. Always leaves you wanting more- especially with the house hummus and sauces. The people are just as awesome as the food.

Great falafel, hummus, and eggplant. Patio is a bit dated, but the shade is great. If you know a vegetarian, I would kindly force them to come here. I'm not as crazy about it when delivered, as the falafel are not quite as crispy after they cool. Big groups may have trouble getting a spot inside. Baklava is a wonderful treat here, just like my Greek aunt makes.

We came here based on all the rave reviews on yelp, Google, etc. I honestly have no clue what the fuss is all about. This was some of the worst Mediterranean food I've ever had in my life.

I ordered the chicken shawarma plate, my friend had the schnitzel,  and we split fried cauliflower with tahini.  My chicken was extremely dry, no flavor, and obviously not made in a traditional manner. Shawarma shares its origins with gyros and tacos al pastor, being roasted on a spit for hours. Generally BURSTING with flavor, and juicy. The salad was ordinary, the rice lacked any distinguishable flavor, the hummus was a tad gritty.

My friend's plate, the schnitzel,  followed suit,  was basically burnt and very dry.

The cauliflower was the only thing I'd consider repeating, that was decent but not a reason to return. 

Service was good, the counter person was very nice and helpful.

Decor was basically an old house with some paint splashed here in there, you could see it was is need of maintenance.  No coincidence, the lights were very low, I doubt you'd want to see the place in full light.

I so wanted to love this place, starting as a food cart, my friend is working on starting his own food truck, and this was research of a sort. If this food passes for good, he has nothing to worry about.

With their hundreds of 4-5 star reviews, I doubt they'll even care about mine, but I'm still dumbfounded as to why anyone would think this place was something to rave about.

If you like Mediterranean food this is your place.  We were meeting up with family.  Bunny and I and a few others were just getting into town so why not al meet up for lunch. 

In the end about 12 of us were meeting and this lace is sort of small.  They do have seating outside but it was a frosty -3 so that was NOT going to happen.  they also have another room and an upstairs location but they were working on the other room.

We waited for everyone to arrive and we were seated.  They had another large party there already but they found room for us.  We took menus down to see what we wanted then a few at a time went up to order.  It worked out well as you need to order before finding a seat anyway.

They have a larger menu and something for everyone including vegans, veggie eaters and carnivores.   They is falafel, chicken, ground beef, and you can t get it in a pita, on a plate, or a salad.  There is also a hummus plate, different sides like Falafel, Couscous Tabouli, Babaganush, Hummus, Chopped Salad, Majadra Rice, and hand cut fries.  There is also soup and they have a soup of the day and lentil.

For drinks there is soda, wine, beer, bottled drinks, tea, coffee and Turkish coffee complete with the little cooking pot and spout.  They also deliver and have lunch specials and if your company is having an event they have Food carts.

We ordered just about everything on the menu.  First it was drinks with teas, coffees, wine (we had the bottle), couple beers, sodas, and bottled drinks.  Then we started placing orders and most of our food came out together which was nice.  We all dug in.  The food was AMAZING so good!

The hand-cut fires were yummy!  I got the falafel salad with was DELISH!  Everyone LOVED there F-BOMBS, and other pita sands and well as the few plates we had on our table.  

GOOD FOOD, GREAT conversation and a good time was had!  It was great we all could fit in one room and just hang out with my mid-west, and SoCal Fam BAM to start the holi-dolies!  I will definitely come back here.  The employees were so accommodating and nice!  Being there was 12 of us we got a little loud at times and we stayed longer than the norm but they didn't mind at all.
Exceptional falafel at the food truck. Interesting and varied ingredients in the pita along with the falafel. Highly recommended.

I live in Milwaukee and have been on an extensive search for a good falafel pita.  With no avail, I saw a take out menu for this place while visiting madison on my boyfriend's father's fridge.  Scanning through the menu, I knew I wanted to go the next day.  It was a great experience.  Good customer service, freshly made food.  I have never knowingly had authentic Israeli hummus.  My god. Exquisite.  Heavy on the tahini, plenty of oil and parsley, and great fresh pita bread for dipping.  The Banzo Pita was out of this world, everything I've ever wanted from a falafel pita. Can't say I have ever found anything that can rival this place.  I hope they do well, definitely going to be one of my favorite places to go while visiting Madison.  Hummus can be very addicting.  Overall great prices, great service, great dishes.    Big servings, so be ready for bringing some home.

Tried Banzo Falafel first time and it was good. I love Falafel sandwiches and glad that I tried Banzo. I had Falafel pitta sandwich. It was great. Going to try different varieties from Banzo soon:

Great work guys !!

I got the Harvest Platter or plate, I can't remember! But the falafel was effing amaaaazing.
The hummus was on point,
The pitas were earm, delicious, and toasty.  The hot sauce was worth the extra 25 cents.
Their minimum delivery isn't insane. You don't haaave to order 2 person (s) worth of food.

They were around a half an hour faster than grub hub predicted so that was awesome :)
Holy yum.

They've got the best falafel I've ever eaten. They fly their pita in from Israel! Their hummus and tdaziki sauce is great. I should try other things but the F-Bomb plate (two falafels, 2 meat kabobs) is so Effing Fantastic that I just keep ordering it every f'ing time!
